ligo: <entryFree id="n26594" type="main" key="li^go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">lug</foreign>in <foreign lang="greek">lu/gos, lugo/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n26594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tie, bind, bind together</hi>, <pb n="1065" /> <cb n="LIGU" /> <hi rend="ital">bind up, bandage, bind fast</hi>, etc. (syn.: vincio, destino; perh. only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n26594.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus post terga ligatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 575</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligare et vincire crura et manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crus fasciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueo guttura,</quote> <trans><tr>to tie up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera veste,</quote> <trans><tr>to bind up, bandage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:849" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 849</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum mula ligatur,</quote> <trans><tr>is harnessed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funem litoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudarium circum collum,</quote> <trans><tr>to bind around</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces in glacie ligatos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>frozen fast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbi ligati,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ice</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26594.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to wind round, to surround</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">balteus loricam ligat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:94" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitosque ligat junctura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 375</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:589" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 589</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26594.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fix</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fasten in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">igne cremato lapide caementa in tectis ligantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 27, 68, § 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26594.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bind up, bind together, unite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissociata locis concordi pace ligavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinclo propiore cum aliquo ligari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:548" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 548</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueo colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:6:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 6, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26594.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To ratify, confirm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 82: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugia artibus magicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 452" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 452</bibl></cit>: argumenta in catenas, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 32</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">connected with, adjoining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tartari ripis ligatos squalidae mortis specus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 742" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 742</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26595" type="main" key="li^go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭgo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mattock, grub-axe, hoe</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26595.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">longis purgare ligonibus arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:59" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligonibus duris humum Exhaurire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:30" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligonibus Versare glebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 6, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 10, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">centeno ligone domare arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:64:32" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 64, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fractus, so called from the bent form of the iron, Col. poët. 10, 88: erectum domito referens a monte ligonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:89" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26595.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">defluit aetas Et pelagi patiens et cassidis atque ligonis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>tillage, agriculture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:33" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ligula: <entryFree id="n26596" type="main" key="li^gu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭgŭla</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lingŭla</orth> (v. infra), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>from lingua: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis me ligulam dicant Equitesque Patresque, Dicor ab indoctis lingula grammaticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:120" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 120</bibl></cit></etym>, <sense id="n26596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little tongue;</hi> hence, transf. </sense><sense id="n26596.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tongue of land</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida posita in extremis lingulis promontoriisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26596.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The tongue of a shoe, a shoe-strap, shoe-latchet</hi>: lingula per diminutionem linguae dicta; alias a similitudine linguae exsertae, ut in calceis, alias insertae, id est intra dentes coërcitae, ut in tibiis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=116" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 116</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">habet Trebius, propter quod rumpere somnum debeat et ligulas dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:20" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:29:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 29, 7</bibl>.—As a term of reproach: <cit><quote lang="la">ligula, i in malam crucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26596.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A spoon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ladle</hi> for skimming a pot, <hi rend="ital">a skimmer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">isque (musteus fructus) saepius ligula purgandus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—For taking out and dropping aromatic essences: <cit><quote lang="la">inde lingulis eligunt florem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 14, 49, § 84</bibl></cit>.—For preserves, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26596.4" n="B" level="2"> As a measure, <hi rend="ital">a spoonful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duarum aut trium lingularum mensura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 18, § 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26596.5" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small sword</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 3</bibl>; ct. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 107</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n26596.6" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The tongue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reed</hi> of a flute, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 171</bibl>; cf. under II. the passage cited from Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=116" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 116</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n26596.7" n="VI" level="1"> The pointed end of a post or stake, which was inserted into something, <hi rend="ital">a tongue, tenon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingulae edolatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26596.8" n="VII" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The short arm</hi> of a lever, which is placed under the weight to be raised: <cit><quote lang="la">si sub onus vectis lingula subjecta fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26596.9" n="VIII" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The tongueshaped extremity</hi> of a water-pipe, by which it is fitted into another, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26596.10" n="IX" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The tongue of a scale-beam</hi>: examen est ligula et lignum, quod mediam hastam ad pondera adaequanda tenet, Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26596.11" n="X" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tongue-shaped member of the cuttle-fish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loliginum ligulas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 297, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ligures: <entryFree id="n26597" type="main" key="Li^gu^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭgŭres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Ligurians, an Italian people in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, in the mod. <hi rend="ital">Piedmont, Genoa</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">Lucca</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montani duri atque agrestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:73:255" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 73, 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:33" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:39" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 370</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:3:2 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 3, 2 al.</bibl>: Ligures omnes fallaces, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 701</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae motus in Liguribus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in Liguria</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 35, 78</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n26597.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭgur</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭgus</orth>, <itype>ŭris</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. comm., Ligurian;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst., a Ligurian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ligus iste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:31:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 31, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vane Ligus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonse Ligur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina Ligus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: Ligus ora, <cb n="LILI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:6" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">securis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 16, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26597.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭ-gur</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭgus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Aelia <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Octavia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 23, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26597.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭgŭrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Liguria, a country of Cisalpine Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7</bibl>. § 48; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26597.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭgŭrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Ligurian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ligurinae Alpes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 510</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26597.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭgŭrīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a favorite of Horace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 33</bibl>. To him is addressed C. 4, 10.—</sense><sense id="n26597.6" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭgustĭcus</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭguscus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:5:9" default="NO">2, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:9:17" default="NO">3, 9, 17</bibl>, acc. to the MSS.; cf. Etruscus), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ligustiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Ligustine, Ligurian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 10, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:257" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 257</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26597.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭgustĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a plant indigenous to Liguria, lovage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:57:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 57, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 50, § 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:168" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 15, 60, § 168</bibl> (corrupted into Levisticum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 52, 2</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n26597.8" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭgustīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ligusti-no/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Ligustine, Ligurian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 35</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭgustīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Ligurians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 24, 34, § 71</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26597.9" n="F" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭgustis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ligusti/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Ligurian</hi>: gente cretus in Ligustide, Sid. poët. Ep. 9, 15.</sense></entryFree>
ligurio: <entryFree id="n26598" type="main" key="li^gu_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭgūrĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭgurrĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi and ĭi, ītum</itype> (<sense id="n26598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> ligurribant, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12, 17</bibl>), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root lig-; cf. lingo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to lick.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n26598.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to be dainty, fond of good things</hi> (cf. lambo): <cit><quote lang="la">quae (meretrices) cum amatore cum cenant, liguriunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26598.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to lick</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26598.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes non, ut muscae, (eum) liguriunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semesos pisces tepidumque jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26598.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ruri rurant homines, quos (parasiti) liguriant,</quote> <trans><tr>whom they lick, whom they daintily feed upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furta,</quote> <trans><tr>to lick up, feast on by stealth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 79</bibl></cit>.—Also in mal. part., as Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lei/xein</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">leixa/zein</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:58" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26598.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to long for, desire eagerly, lust after</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">improbissima lucra liguriens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:76:section=177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 76, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrariam curationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 21, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
liguritio: <entryFree id="n26599" type="hapax" key="li^gu_ri_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭgūrītio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lĭgurr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ligurio</etym>, <sense id="n26599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fondness for dainties, daintiness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liguritio, vinolentia, cupedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
liguritor: <entryFree id="n26600" type="main" key="li^gu_ri_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭgūrītor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lĭgurr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n26600.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One fond of dainties, an epicure, gourmand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eumque quasi liguritorem catillonem appellat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26600.1" n="II" level="1"> In mal. part., <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 128</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm</hi>.</sense><sense id="n26600.2" n="1" level="3"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭgūrĭus</orth>, <itype>gulosus, catillo</itype>, <foreign lang="greek">li/xnos</foreign>, Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
ligurius: <entryFree id="n26601" type="main" key="li^gu_ri^us1" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭgūrĭus</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 28, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 39, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26602" type="main" key="li^gu_ri^us2" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭgūrĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gem</hi>, v. lyncurium.</sense></entryFree>
ligurra: <entryFree id="n26603" type="main" key="Li^gurra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭgurra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:61" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ligus: <entryFree id="n26604" type="main" key="Li^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭgus, Lĭguscus, Lĭgustĭcus, Lĭgustīnus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lĭgustis</orth>, v. Ligures.</entryFree>
ligustrum: <entryFree id="n26605" type="main" key="li^gustrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭgustrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n26605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, privet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alba ligustra cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidior folio nivei, Galatea, ligustri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loto candidior puella cygno, argento, nive, lilio, ligustro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:116:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 116, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26605.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <hi rend="ital">which</hi>, acc. to Pliny, <hi rend="ital">was held by some to be the</hi> cyprus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 24, 55, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:74" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 10, 45, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:77" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 18, 31, § 77</bibl>.—To this perhaps may be referred ligustrum nigrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:300" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 300</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lilaea: <entryFree id="n26606" type="main" key="Li^laea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭlaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*li/laia</foreign>, <sense id="n26606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Phocis, situated at the sources of the Cephisus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Paleokastro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:348" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 348</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liliaceus: <entryFree id="n26607" type="main" key="li_li^a_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līlĭācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lilium</etym>, <sense id="n26607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from lilies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <trans><tr>oil of lilies</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 6, 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
lilietum: <entryFree id="n26608" type="main" key="li_li^e_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līlĭētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bed of lilies</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 21, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lilinus: <entryFree id="n26609" type="main" key="li_li^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līlĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., made from lilies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 18, § 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lilium: <entryFree id="n26610" type="main" key="li_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līlĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">lei/rion</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n26610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lilium rosae nobilitate promixum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:126" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 19, 74, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:35" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 21, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">candida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit> (4, 12), 30: <cit><quote lang="la">argentea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:4:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">breve,</quote> <trans><tr>short-lived, that blooms but for a short time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 36, 16</bibl></cit>: rubens, = <foreign lang="greek">kri/non</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a reddish kind of lily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26610.1" n="II" level="1"> <cb n="LIMB" /> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sort of defence, consisting of several rows of pits, in which stakes were planted, rising only four inches above the surface of the ground</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lilybaeum: <entryFree id="n26611" type="main" key="Li^ly^baeum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭlybaeum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ŏn</orth> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 726</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lilu/baion</foreign>, <sense id="n26611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory on the southern coast of Sicily, with a town of the same name</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Capo Bœo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:15" default="NO">15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:16" default="NO">16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:351 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 351 al.</bibl>—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭlybē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, acc. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*lilu/bh</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 482</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26611.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭlybaetānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lilybæan, of Lilybæum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lyso Lilybaetanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26611.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭlybaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lilybæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 583</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26611.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭlybēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lilybæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 706</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lima: <entryFree id="n26612" type="main" key="li_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. unknown</etym>, <sense id="n26612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a file</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26612.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">limā proterere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limā aliquid avellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limā aliquid polire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 41, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">topazius limam sentit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 8, 32, § 109</bibl></cit>: confitendum est detrahere doctrinam aliquid, ut limam rudibus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vipera limam momordit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26612.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a file</hi>, as applied to literary compositions, i. e. <hi rend="ital">polishing, revision</hi> (not in Cic.; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, however, limatus, under limo): defuit et scriptis ultima lima meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:7:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipiam limā mordacius uti, Et sub judicium singula verba vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limae labor et mora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina rasa limā recenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illis limae, in hoc plus videtur fuisse sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:9:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad limam consilii desiderium petitoris distulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 204 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
limaceus: <entryFree id="n26613" type="main" key="li_ma_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. limus</etym>, <sense id="n26613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of mud, slime</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">earth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus homo de terra choicus, id est limaceus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
limaeas: <entryFree id="n26614" type="main" key="Limaeas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Limaeas</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Limaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (Limia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 20, 34, § 112</bibl>), <sense id="n26614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, now <hi rend="ital">Lima</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 21, 35, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limarius: <entryFree id="n26615" type="main" key="li_ma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. limus</etym>, <sense id="n26615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to slime</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limaria piscina,</quote> <trans><tr>where the water, as it flows off, deposits slime</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 15" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
limate: <entryFree id="n26616" type="main" key="li_ma_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. limo, <sense id="n26616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
limatio: <entryFree id="n26617" type="main" key="li_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (prop. a filing; hence), <sense id="n26617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a diminishing</hi> (of the body), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:11" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limator: <entryFree id="n26618" type="gloss" key="li_ma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmātor</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">r(inhth/s</foreign> (<sense id="n26618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a filer</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
limatulus: <entryFree id="n26619" type="hapax" key="li_ma_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmātŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [limatus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat filed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">polished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus est huc limatulo et polito tuo judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 33, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
limatura: <entryFree id="n26620" type="gloss" key="li_ma_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmātūra</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">r(i/nhma</foreign> (<sense id="n26620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">file-dust, filings</hi>), Gloss. Vet.</sense></entryFree>
limatus: <entryFree id="n26621" type="main" key="li_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. limo.</entryFree>
limax: <entryFree id="n26622" type="main" key="li_max"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (less freq. <gen>m.</gen>) [kindred with 2. limus: <sense id="n26622.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">limax a limo quod ibi vivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 64</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: limaces cochleae a limo appellatae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=116" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 116</bibl> Müll.], <hi rend="ital">a slug, snail</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26622.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicitus conchae limax, Col. poët. 10, 323: limacis inter duas orbitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 36, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limaces nascuntur in vicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactucis innascuntur limaces et cochleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 10, 57, § 177</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26622.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: limaces lividae, of courtesans, Plaut. Fragm. ap. Varr. l. l.; so perh. limaces viri, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 4, 274</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limbatus: <entryFree id="n26623" type="hapax" key="limba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">limbātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>limbus</etym>, <sense id="n26623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">edged, bordered</hi>: chlamydes, Gallien. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limbolarius: <entryFree id="n26624" type="main" key="limbo^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">limbŏlārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of edgings</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fringes</hi> for ladies' dresses, <hi rend="ital">a fringe-maker</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">textores limbolarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4213</bibl>; cf. ‡ limbolarius, <foreign lang="greek">qusanopra/kths</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
limbus: <entryFree id="n26625" type="main" key="limbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">limbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a border</hi> that surrounds any thing, <hi rend="ital">a hem, welt, edge, selvage, fringe; a belt, band, girdle</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26625.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sidoniam picto chlamydem circumdata limbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 616</bibl> (this the better read., others nimbo): <cit><quote lang="la">indutus chlamydem Tyriam, quam limbus obibat Aureus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 127</bibl>; 2, 734; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 330</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem limbo velata pudicam,</quote> <trans><tr>with a headband, fillet</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 118</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imminuerent frontes limbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 72</bibl></cit>: picto discingit pectora limbo, <hi rend="ital">with a girdle</hi>, <pb n="1066" /> <cb n="LIME" /> <hi rend="ital">belt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:367" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 367</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26625.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n26625.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The zodiac</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra limbum XII. signorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; id. ap. Prob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26625.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A noose, snare</hi>, for catching animals, <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limen: <entryFree id="n26626" type="main" key="li_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">le/xris, loco/s</foreign>; Lat. obliquus, līmus; hence prop. a cross-piece</etym>, <sense id="n26626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a threshold; the head-piece</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foot-piece</hi> of a doorway, <hi rend="ital">the lintel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the sill</hi> (limen superum et inferum). </sense><sense id="n26626.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen superum inferumque, salve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: limen superum, quod mihi misero saepe confregit caput: Inferum autem, ubi ego omnis digitos defregi meos, Novius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 336, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensim super attolle limen pedes, nova nupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imponere foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 14, 21, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad limen consulis adesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo limine,</quote> <trans><tr>at the outer threshold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:96" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 96</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">haec limina, intra quae puer est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:45" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:220" default="NO">220</bibl>.—The moment of touching the threshold was regarded as ominous: <cit><quote lang="la">ter limen tetigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:55" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 55</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: salutare a limine, <hi rend="ital">to greet in passing</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to touch upon slightly, not go deeply into</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 49:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 49, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26626.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26626.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A door, entrance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi hanc ego tetulero intra limen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intrare intra limen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra limen cohibere se,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep within doors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmoreo stridens in limine cardo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 222</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores in liminibus profanarum aedium januae nominantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad valvas se templi limenque convertisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penetrare aulas et limina regum,</quote> <trans><tr>the courts and doors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipso in limine portae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 242</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tremuitque saepe limite in primo sonipes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 629" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 629</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famuli ad limina,</quote> <trans><tr>doorkeepers, porters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:66" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in limine portūs,</quote> <trans><tr>at the very entrance of the haven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 598</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densos per limina tende corymbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:52" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26626.4" n="2" level="3"> Still more gen., <hi rend="ital">a house, dwelling, abode</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronae nulla auctoritate virorum contineri limine poterant,</quote> <trans><tr>in the house, at home</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad limen consulis adesse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limine pelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 579</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26626.5" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the barrier</hi> in a race-course: <cit><quote lang="la">limen relinquunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 316</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26626.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, both entrance and exit. </sense><sense id="n26626.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A beginning, commencement</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">leti limine in ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in limine belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso statim limine obstare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in limine victoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:17" default="NO">6, 9, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:26" default="NO">9, 10, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a limine ipso mortis revocatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 44, 45, § 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 22:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 22, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:3:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 3, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26626.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An end, termination</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso finitae lucis limine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 267, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">limina sicut in domibus finem quendam faciunt, sic et imperii finem limen esse veteres voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:12:section=5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 12, § 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
limenarcha: <entryFree id="n26627" type="main" key="li^me^narcha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭmĕnarcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vox hybrida; limen, <foreign lang="greek">a)/rxw</foreign>; cf. Germ. Markgraf; Engl. margrave</etym>, <sense id="n26627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a commander on the frontier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limenarchae et stationarii fugitivos deprehensos recte in custodiam retinent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 6, 3</bibl> (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">a harbor-master, port-warden</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
limentinus: <entryFree id="n26628" type="main" key="Li_menti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Līmentīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>limen</etym>, <sense id="n26628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deity who presided over the threshold</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cor. Mil. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 132</bibl> sq.; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8; 6, 7.</sense></entryFree>
limes: <entryFree id="n26629" type="main" key="li_me^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root in līmus; cf. limen, and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">le/xris</foreign>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:12:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 12, 5</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n26629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cross-path, balk</hi> between fields. </sense><sense id="n26629.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, the Romans usually had in their fields two broad and two narrower paths; the principal balk from east to west was called limes decumanus; that from north to south was called cardo; <cit><quote lang="la">of the two smaller ones, that running from east to west was called prorus, the other, from north to south, transversus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:de Limit. Const. 18:33" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> de Limit. Const. 18, 33</bibl></cit> and 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lutosi limites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26629.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n26629.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A boundary, limit</hi> between two fields or estates, consisting of a stone or a balk: <cit><quote lang="la">partiri limite campum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum antiquum, ingens, campo quod forte jacebat, Limes agro positus, litem ut discerneret arvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:897" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 897</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effodit medio de limite saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26629.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fortified boundaryline, a boundary-wall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta inter castellum Alisonem ac Rhenum novis limitibus aggeribusque permunita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limite acto promotisque praesidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 29</bibl></cit>: penetrat<cb n="LIMN" />  interius, aperit limites, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 120</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26629.5" n="3" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">any path, passage, road, way;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">by-street, by-road</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo limite Athenienses signa extulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profectus inde transversis limitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lato te limite ducam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acclivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limite recto fugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:782" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 782</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transversi,</quote> <trans><tr>by-roads</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 12, 2</bibl></cit> Fabr.; 31, 39, 5; 41, 14 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: limes Appiae, <hi rend="ital">the line of the Appian street</hi> (for the street itself), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 15, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">limite acto (i. e. facto),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 29</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the channel of a stream: solito dum flumina currant Limite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 558</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:9:60" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 9, 60</bibl>.—Of the track of light left behind them by comets, fiery meteors, torches, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">flammiferumque trahens spatioso limite crinem, Stella micat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:849" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 849</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum longo limite sulcus Dat lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 697</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 26, 25, § 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sectus in obliquo est lato curvamine limes,</quote> <trans><tr>the zodiac</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latum per agmen Ardens limitem agit ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 514</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:463" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 463</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:379" default="NO">9, 379</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:182" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 182</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26629.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A line</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vein</hi> in a precious stone: <cit><quote lang="la">nigram materiam distinguente limite albo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 69, § 184</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26629.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26629.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A boundary, limit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limes carminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:16" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestuat infelix angusto limite mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:169" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 169</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26629.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A distinction, difference</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium brevi limite falle tuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam perquam tenui limite dividuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26629.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A way, path</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si maledicitis vostro gradiar limite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene meritis de patria quasi limes ad caeli aditum patet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Somn. Scip. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:15:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eundem limitem agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to go the same way, employ the same means</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 558</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
limeum: <entryFree id="n26630" type="main" key="lime^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">limĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n26630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of herb, with the poisonous juice of which the Gauls anointed their arrows used in hunting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 76, § 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limia: <entryFree id="n26631" type="main" key="Limia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Limia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Limaeas.</entryFree>
limici: <entryFree id="n26632" type="greek" key="Limici"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Limici</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n26632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plur., a people of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limicola: <entryFree id="n26633" type="hapax" key="li_mi^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>limus-colo</etym>, <sense id="n26633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dweller in the mud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostreae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 7, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
limigenus: <entryFree id="n26634" type="main" key="li_mi^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>limus-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n26634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">produced in mud</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slime, mud-born</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mosell. 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
liminaris: <entryFree id="n26635" type="main" key="li_mi^na_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmĭnāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>limen</etym>, <sense id="n26635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to a threshold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lintel</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26635.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes,</quote> <trans><tr>ceiling-beams</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26635.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pagina,</quote> <trans><tr>the first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 67" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 67</bibl></cit>, n. 2.</sense></entryFree>
liminium: <entryFree id="n26636" type="main" key="li^mi^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭmĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>a lengthened form of limen, assumed as accounting for the form postliminium</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 8, 36</bibl>; v. post-liminium.</entryFree>
limis: <entryFree id="n26637" type="main" key="li_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. 1. limus.</entryFree>
limitaneus: <entryFree id="n26638" type="main" key="li_mita_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmitānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>limes</etym>, <sense id="n26638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is on the borders</hi> (late Lat.): agri limitanei, <hi rend="ital">situated on the borders</hi>: milites, <hi rend="ital">frontier troops</hi>, Cod. 11, 59, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Nigr. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limitaris: <entryFree id="n26639" type="main" key="li_mi^ta_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmĭtāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is on the border</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <trans><tr>a path that runs between two fields</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:4:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 4, § 21</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
limitatio: <entryFree id="n26640" type="main" key="li_mi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>limito</etym>, <sense id="n26640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fixing, determination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limitatio terrae vinealis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limitatione cognita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
limito: <entryFree id="n26641" type="main" key="li_mi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>limes</etym>, <sense id="n26641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to enclose within boundaries</hi> or <hi rend="ital">limits, to bound</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26641.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineas limitari decumano XVIII. pedum latitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 169</bibl></cit>; cf.: limitatus ager est in centurias dimensus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=116" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 116</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n26641.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fix, settle, determine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limitata est pecuaria quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
limitotrophus: <entryFree id="n26642" type="main" key="li_mi^totro^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmĭtotrŏphus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">līmĭtrŏphus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>limes <foreign lang="greek">trofe/w</foreign></etym>: agri, <sense id="n26642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lands set apart to furnish subsistence to the troops stationed on the frontiers</hi> (limitanei), Cod. 11, 59, 3.</sense></entryFree>
limma: <entryFree id="n26643" type="greek" key="limma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">limma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lei=mma</foreign> (a remainder; <sense id="n26643.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">hence),</quote> <trans><tr>a semitone</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 1, § 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
limnaea: <entryFree id="n26644" type="main" key="Limnaea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Limnaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*limnai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n26644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kortikhi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
limnatis: <entryFree id="n26645" type="main" key="Limna_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Limnātis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*limna=tis</foreign> (that lives in marshes), <sense id="n26645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Diana</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum Dianae Limnatidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 43 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> (Ms. Flor. Liminatidis).</sense></entryFree>
limne: <entryFree id="n26646" type="greek" key="limne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">limnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">li/mnh</foreign>, <sense id="n26646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus qui limne asphaltites appellabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
limnestis: <entryFree id="n26647" type="greek" key="limnestis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">limnestis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">limnētis</orth>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">limnh=stis</foreign>, <sense id="n26647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, called also</hi> centaurea major, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 34</bibl>. <cb n="LIMP" /></sense></entryFree>
limnice: <entryFree id="n26648" type="main" key="limni^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">limnĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">limnikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n26648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pond-lily, sword-lily</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limo: <entryFree id="n26649" type="main" key="li_mo_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. limus <sense id="n26649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26650" type="main" key="li_mo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (arch. limassis, for limaveris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Com. 140" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> Com. 140</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lima</etym>, <sense id="n26650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to file</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26650.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmis scalpendis atque limandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 10, § 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26650.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26650.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To file off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbum limatum,</quote> <trans><tr>lead-filings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 50, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limata scobs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornum limatum lima lignaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:141" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acumen ossis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26650.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To rub, whet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu ad saxa limato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 20, 29, § 71</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, limare caput cum aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>to kiss</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26650.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26650.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to file, polish, finish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam institui, quae limantur a me politius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stilus hoc maxime ornat ac limat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ars aliquid limare non possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir nostrorum hominum urbanitate limatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:29:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 29, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26650.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26650.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To investigate accurately, to clear of every thing superfluous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritas ipsa limatur in disputatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:10:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtiliter mendacium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 49</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26650.9" n="2" level="3"> Cum se ipse consulto ad minutarum causarum genera limaverit, <hi rend="ital">has prepared one's self thoroughly for</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 3, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26650.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To file off, take away from, diminish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum alteri affinxit, de altero limavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tua prolixa beneficaque natura limavit aliquid posterior annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoda alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum inde decoquent anni, multum ratio limabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">līmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., polished, refined, elegant, fine, accurate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir oratione maxime limatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jure madens, varioque togae limatus in usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:51:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 51, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressum limatumque genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:3" default="NO">11, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limatius dicendi genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:24:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 24, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comis et urbanus fuerit limatior idem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limatius ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 21</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">līmātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">finely, elegantly, accurately; comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limatius scriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:5:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limatius quaerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26651" type="main" key="li_mo3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. limus</etym>, <sense id="n26651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bemire, besmirch</hi> (in double sense, v. 2. limo, I. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">caput alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n26651.1" n="4" level="3"> † <orth extent="full" lang="la">Līmo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leimw/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Meadow</hi>, the name of a writing of Cicero, Suet. Vit. Ter.—</sense><sense id="n26651.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>: C. Apronius Limo, Ascon. ap. Cic. Or. pro Scauro.</sense></entryFree>
limocinctus: <entryFree id="n26652" type="gloss" key="li_mo^cinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmŏcinctus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>3. limus-cingo, girt with an apron</etym>, <sense id="n26652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of public attendant on magistrates</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3219</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limodoron: <entryFree id="n26653" type="greek" key="li_mo^do_ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmŏdōron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">limo/dwron</foreign>, <sense id="n26653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 10, 57, § 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limone: <entryFree id="n26654" type="main" key="Li_mo_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Līmōnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Hippomenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:461" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 461</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limonia: <entryFree id="n26655" type="greek" key="li_mo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leimwni/a</foreign>. <sense id="n26655.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant, called also</hi> scolymos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 43, § 86</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26655.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of anemone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 38, § 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limoniades: <entryFree id="n26656" type="main" key="Li_mo_ni^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Līmōnĭădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, = <foreign lang="greek">*leimwnia/des</foreign>, <sense id="n26656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the nymphs of the meadows and flowers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 10, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limoniatis: <entryFree id="n26657" type="greek" key="li_mo_ni^a_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmōnĭātis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leimwnia=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n26657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of a green color</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the emerald</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 62, § 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limonion: <entryFree id="n26658" type="greek" key="li_mo_ni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmōnĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leimw/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n26658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wild beet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 8, 28, § 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limonum: <entryFree id="n26659" type="main" key="Limo_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Limōnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n26659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Aquitanian Gaul</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Poitiers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:26:27" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 26, 27</bibl> (al. Limo).</sense></entryFree>
limosus: <entryFree id="n26660" type="main" key="li_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. limus</etym>, <sense id="n26660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of mud</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slime, slimy, miry, muddy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (aqua) flumine Nilo fertur, adeo est limosa atque turbida, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 5" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B.
