Alex. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limosoque palus obducit pascua junco,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>growing in muddy places</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 1, 17, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">līmōsa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">muddy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">miry places</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 42, 66, § 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
limpide: <entryFree id="n26661" type="main" key="limpi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">limpĭdē</orth>, v. limpidus <sense id="n26661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
limpiditas: <entryFree id="n26662" type="main" key="limpi^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">limpĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>limpidus</etym>, <sense id="n26662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lucidity, clearness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Jornand.</author> Reb. Goth. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
limpido: <entryFree id="n26663" type="main" key="limpi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">limpĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>limpidus</etym>, <sense id="n26663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make clear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clean, to cleanse</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18</bibl>; Mac. Carm. 2, 5. <pb n="1067" /> <cb n="LINA" /></sense></entryFree>
limpidus: <entryFree id="n26664" type="main" key="limpi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">limpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">la/mpw</foreign>; cf. lepor, O-lymp-us</etym>, <sense id="n26664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clear, bright, pellucid, transparent, limpid</hi> (poet and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limpidior aqua fiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum limpidissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:28:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limpidae chrysolithi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 42, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 184</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26664.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pure, clean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 1:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:18:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 2, 18, 103</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lim-pĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., clearly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:30" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26664.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:1:6" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
limpitudo: <entryFree id="n26665" type="hapax" key="limpi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">limpĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>limpidus</etym>, <sense id="n26665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clearness, brightness, transparency</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 54, § 154</bibl></cit> (Jahn, latitudo).</sense></entryFree>
limula: <entryFree id="n26666" type="hapax" key="li_mu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lima</etym>, <sense id="n26666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little file, a file</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2390" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2390</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
limulus: <entryFree id="n26667" type="hapax" key="li_mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. limus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat askance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limulis (oculis) intueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
limus: <entryFree id="n26668" type="main" key="li_mus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">līmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 9, 2</bibl>; <sense id="n26668.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">le/xrios, le/xris, loco/s</foreign>; Lat. licinus, ob-liquus, luxus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">sidelong, askew, aslant, askance</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26668.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">limis oculis aspicere,</quote> <trans><tr>to look sideways, look askance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limis subrisit ocellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(leones) nec limis intuentur oculis aspicique simili modo nolunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 19, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limibus oculis eos contuens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 9</bibl></cit>.—So, limis aspicere (sc. oculis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">limi, et ut sic dicam venerei (sc. oculi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi contuitu quoque multiformes, truces et limi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limi Di,</quote> <trans><tr>the guardian gods of obliquities</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26668.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons, <hi rend="ital">looking sideways</hi>: neque post respiciens, neque ante prospiciens, sed limus intra limites culinae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 133, 31</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 442, 33</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">līmō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sideways, askance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leones numquam limo vident,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27, 20</bibl></cit>; for which: limis oculis in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 19, § 52</bibl> (v. the passage above).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26669" type="main" key="li_mus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root lib-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lei/bw</foreign>, to pour; cf. Lat. lino; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">li/mnh, limh/n</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n26669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slime, mud, mire</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26669.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque omnis mundi quasi limus in imum Confluxit gravis et subsedit funditus ut faex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 496</bibl></cit>: luta et limum aggerebant, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 212, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenti acervos sedisse illitos limo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profundo limo cum ipsis equis hausti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis abundans Exit et obducto late tenet omnia limo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes Felicem trahunt limum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limo Turbata aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteri craterae limus adhaesit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26669.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26669.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Excrement in the intestines</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26669.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dirt, mire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limumque inducere monstrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:759" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 759</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26669.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">filth, pollution</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora sic mihi sunt limo vitiata malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26670" type="main" key="li_mus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. for lig-mus, from ligo</etym>, <sense id="n26670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a girdle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apron trimmed with purple</hi>, which the sacrificing priests and other servants of the magistrates wore about the abdomen: <cit><quote lang="la">velati limo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 120</bibl></cit>; cf.: limus autem est vestis, qua ab umbilico usque ad pedes teguntur pudenda poparum. Haec autem vestis in extremo sui purpuram limam, i. e. flexuosam habet. Unde et nomen accepit. Nam limum obliquum dicimus, Serv. ad Verg. l. l.: licio transverso, quod limum appellatur, cincti erant, Tiro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26671" type="main" key="Li_mus4" n="4"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Līmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god of oblique glances</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4</bibl>, cap. 9.</sense></entryFree>
limyra: <entryFree id="n26672" type="main" key="Li^my^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭmyra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭmyrē</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 646</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭmyra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:102" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 102</bibl>), <sense id="n26672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river, with a town of the same name, in Lycia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 28, § 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
linamentum: <entryFree id="n26673" type="main" key="li_na_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>linum</etym>, <sense id="n26673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">linen-stuff, linen</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n26673.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 46, § 129</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26673.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">lint</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:11:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 11, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">applicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppurationem linamentis curare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:38:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linamentum demittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccis linamentis vulnus implere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
linaria: <entryFree id="n26674" type="gloss" key="li_na_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>linum</etym>, <sense id="n26674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a factory of linen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
linarius: <entryFree id="n26675" type="main" key="li_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>linum</etym>, <sense id="n26675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a linen-weaver, dealer in linen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stat fullo, phrugio, aurifex, linarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 34</bibl></cit> Wagn. (al. lanarius); <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4214</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 649, 3</bibl>. <cb n="LINE" /></sense></entryFree>
linctor: <entryFree id="n26676" type="gloss" key="linctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">linctor</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">li/kths</foreign> (<sense id="n26676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who licks</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
linctus: <entryFree id="n26677" type="main" key="linctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">linctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from lingo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26678" type="main" key="linctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">linctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lingo</etym>, <sense id="n26678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a licking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:971" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 971</bibl></cit> (v. Lachm. ad h. l.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:177" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 15, 50, § 177</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lindus: <entryFree id="n26679" type="main" key="Lindus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lindus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*li/ndos</foreign>, <sense id="n26679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the island of Rhodes, founded by Lindus, brother of Ialysus, with a temple of Minerva</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lindo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 36, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 54</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26679.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lindĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lindus, Lindian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lindia Minerva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 55, § 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cleobulus,</quote> <trans><tr>of Lindus, one of the seven wise men</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Sept. Sap. 1, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
linea: <entryFree id="n26680" type="main" key="li_ne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĕa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">līnĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>linum</etym>, <sense id="n26680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a linen thread, a string, line</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26680.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectere lineas, restes, funes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linia longinqua per os religata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 26, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligato pede longā lineā gallina custoditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linea margaritarum triginta quinque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lineae duae ex margaritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:40" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 34, 2, 40</bibl></cit>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 2, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linea dives (of the strings of pearls which were thrown among the people at the public games),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:78:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 78, 7</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 11</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n26680.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26680.3" n="1" level="3"> In a net, <hi rend="ital">the threads</hi> which form the meshes: <cit><quote lang="la">licia difficile cernuntur: atque ut in plagis lineae offensae, praecipitant in sinum (of spiders' webs),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26680.4" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a net</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 43, 67, § 145</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si feras lineis et pinna clusas contineas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:12:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 12, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26680.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fishing-line</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremulāve captum lineā trahit piscem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:27" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:30:18" default="NO">10, 30, 18</bibl>.—Hence, prov.: mittere lineam, <hi rend="ital">to cast a line, to fish for, try to catch</hi> a person, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26680.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A plumbline</hi> of masons and carpenters: <cit><quote lang="la">perpendiculo et lineā uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad regulam et lineam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 9</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26680.7" n="b" level="4"> Ad lineam and rectā lineā, <hi rend="ital">in a straight line, vertically, perpendicularly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solida corpora ferri suo deorsum pondere ad lineam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 147</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the layers of stone in a wall: saxa, quae rectis lineis suos ordines servant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ignis) rectis lineis in caelestem locum subvolat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26680.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A region, tract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linea tam rectum mundi ferit illa Leonem,</quote> <trans><tr>that region lies directly under the lion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 306</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26680.9" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A bowstring</hi>, Ter. Maur. praef. v. 19.—</sense><sense id="n26680.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a thread-like stroke</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mark</hi> made with a pen, pencil, etc., <hi rend="ital">a line</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apelli fuit perpetua consuetudo, numquam tam occupatam diem agendi, ut non, lineam ducendo, exerceret artem, quod ab eo in proverbium venit (namely, the proverb: nulla dies sine linea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineam cinere ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 33, 76, § 327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candida per medium folium transcurrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 11, 77, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serra in praetenui linea premente harenas (of sawing marble),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 6, 9, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec congruebant ad horas ejus lineae (of the sundial),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 60, 60, § 214</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:4" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 4</bibl>.—In geometry, <hi rend="ital">a line</hi>: linea a nostris dicitur, quam <foreign lang="greek">grammh\n</foreign> Graeci nominant. Eam M. Varro ita definit: <cit><quote lang="la">Linea est, inquit, longitudo quaedam sine latitudine et altitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:20:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum extremae lineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineae, quae emittuntur ex centro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 65, 65, § 165</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 16, 13, § 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linea circumcurrens,</quote> <trans><tr>a circular line, circle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26680.11" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26680.12" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A boundary-line</hi> which consisted of a narrow path between fields, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:de Limit. p. 151" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> de Limit. p. 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:152" default="NO">152</bibl> Goes. —</sense><sense id="n26680.13" n="(b)" level="5"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a way, path</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedit sequendam calle recto lineam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 48</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26680.14" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A barrier</hi> or <hi rend="ital">line</hi> in the theatre, by which the seats were separated from each other: <cit><quote lang="la">quid frustra refugis? cogit nos linea jungi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineas poscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:133" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 133</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26680.15" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A feature, lineament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulti venustissimis lineis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 179 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n26680.16" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26680.17" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A line</hi> of descent or kindred, <hi rend="ital">lineage</hi> (post-class.): <foreign lang="greek">ste/mmata</foreign> cognationum directo limite in duas lineas separantur, quarum altera est superior, altera inferior, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clara gentis Linea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:43" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo gradu superioris linea continentur pater, mater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 4, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26680.18" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An outline, sketch, design</hi> (a fig. borrowed from painting): <cit><quote lang="la">quidam materias latius dicendo prosequebantur ... alii, cum primas modo lineas duxissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 120</bibl>: ea quae <cb n="LING" /> in Platonis oratione demiramur, non aemulari quidem, sed lineas umbrasque facere ausi sumus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:20:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 20, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26680.19" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A boundary-line, bound, limit, end, goal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum poëtae transilire lineas impune possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 5</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quidem est peccare tamquam transire lineas,</quote> <trans><tr>to go beyond the mark, pass the prescribed limits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:1:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors ultima linea rerum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admoveri lineas sentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 49" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 49</bibl></cit>.—Hence, prov.: amare extremā lineā, <hi rend="ital">to love at a distance</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to see the beloved object only at a distance, not be able to speak to her</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 2, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
linealis: <entryFree id="n26681" type="main" key="li_ne^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĕālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>linea</etym>, <sense id="n26681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of lines, made with lines, lineal</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ambitus lineales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĕālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the manner of lines, by means of lines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (circulos) linealiter feci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 834</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lineamentum: <entryFree id="n26682" type="main" key="li_ne^a_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĕāmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">līnĭā-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>linea</etym>, <sense id="n26682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a line</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stroke</hi> made with a pen, with chalk, etc., <hi rend="ital">a mark, line</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26682.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in geometria lineamenta formae, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>lines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:41:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 41, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineamentum, longitudinem latitudine carentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 116</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26682.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26682.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A feature, lineament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae conformatio lineamentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:18:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 18, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineamenta hospitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:36:section=89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 36, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineamenta oris effingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitum oris lineamentaque intueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26682.4" n="2" level="3"> In <number>plur.</number>, of the works of artists, <hi rend="ital">designs, drawings, delineations</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adumbratorum deorum lineamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum lineamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44, § 98</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26682.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a feature, lineament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi lineamenta sunt pulchriora quam corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus quasi quandam palaestram et extrema lineamenta orationi attulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:186" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 56, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catonis lineamentis nihil nisi eorum pigmentorum, quae inventa nondum erant, florem et colorem defuisse,</quote> <trans><tr>sketches, outlines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:87:298" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 87, 298</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
linearis: <entryFree id="n26683" type="main" key="li_ne^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĕāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĭāris</orth>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to lines, consisting of lines, linear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictura,</quote> <trans><tr>the art of drawing with lines, without colors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 3, 5, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <trans><tr>the science of lines, geometry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probatio,</quote> <trans><tr>a proving by means of lines, a mathematical demonstration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 49</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĕārĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by lines</hi>, Boëth. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> Music. 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
linearius: <entryFree id="n26684" type="main" key="li_ne^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to lines, line-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limes,</quote> <trans><tr>a narrow pathway between fields</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:de Limit. p. 152" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> de Limit. p. 152</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
lineatio: <entryFree id="n26685" type="main" key="li_ne^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĕātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the drawing of a line, a line</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis radii paribus lateribus lineationibus extenduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26685.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A feature, lineament</hi>: corporis, Firm. Math. 1, 4.</sense></entryFree>
lineo: <entryFree id="n26686" type="main" key="li_ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĕo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to reduce to a straight line, to make straight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perpendicular</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26686.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolabit, lineabit, secabitque materiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene lineata carina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26686.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pass. part</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26686.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Striped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">basiliscus albis maculis lineatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 12, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 12, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26686.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Decked out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter comatos lineatosque juvenes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 117</bibl></cit>, n. 6.</sense></entryFree>
lineola: <entryFree id="n26687" type="main" key="li_ne^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĕŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little line</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lineus: <entryFree id="n26688" type="main" key="li_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>linum</etym>, <sense id="n26688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of flax</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lint, flaxen, linen-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga,</quote> <trans><tr>the linen lining of a shield</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 784</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 6, 13, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 10, 44, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pannis lineis involvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĕum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a linen garment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 2</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
lingo: <entryFree id="n26689" type="main" key="lingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lingo</orth>, <itype>nxi</itype> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 881</bibl>), <itype>nctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. lih, rih, to lick; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lix-, lei/xw, lixano/s</foreign>; cf. ligurio</etym>, <sense id="n26689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lick, lick up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel mihi videor lingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crepidas carbatinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:98:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 98, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulphur linctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 50, § 177</bibl></cit> (al. linctu): <cit><quote lang="la">sal pecoribus datur lingendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes linguebant ulcera ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:16:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 16, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem Naboth,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3 Reg. 21, 19</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part., like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">leixa/zein</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:55:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 55, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:67:17" default="NO">7, 67, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lingones: <entryFree id="n26690" type="main" key="Lingo^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lingŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Celtic Gaul</hi>, whence the modern name of their chief city, <hi rend="ital">Langres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl>; Plin. <pb n="1068" /> <cb n="LING" /> 4, 17, 31, § <cit><quote lang="la">106.—Afterwards dwelling on the Po,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26690.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lingŏ-nĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lingonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bardocucullus,</quote> <trans><tr>a poor sort of garment worn by the Lingones</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:54:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 54, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <trans><tr>over the Lingones</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Const. 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26690.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lin-gŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Lingonian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:75:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 75, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lingos: <entryFree id="n26691" type="main" key="Lingos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lingos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lingua: <entryFree id="n26692" type="main" key="lingua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lingua</orth> (ante-class. form dingua, like dagrima for lacrima, Mar. Victorin. p. 2457 and 2470 P.; cf. the letter D), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. jihvā; original Lat. form. dingua; A. -S. tunga; Germ. Zunge; Engl. tongue. Not from the root lih, lich, v. lingo</etym>, <sense id="n26692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tongue</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26692.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac proserpentem bestiam me duplicem ut habeam linguam (of a kiss in which the tongues touched each other),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua haeret metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ore sita lingua est, finita dentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguā haesitantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguā properanti legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:5:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguā titubante loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo facilius verba ore libero exprimeret, calculos lingua volvens dicere domi solebat (Demosthenes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: linguam exserere, <hi rend="ital">to thrust out the tongue</hi>, in token of derision or contempt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10</bibl>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">lingua ejecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua minor,</quote> <trans><tr>the epiglottis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 66, § 175</bibl></cit>.—Comically, as mock term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus voluptas, te opsecro, hujus mel, hujus cor, hujus labellum, hujus lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 178</bibl></cit>; cf. v. 175.—In mal. part.: homo malae linguae, <hi rend="ital">a fellow with a bad tongue</hi>, i. q. fellator, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:80:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 80, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26692.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26692.3" n="A" level="2"> Since the tongue is an organ of speech, <hi rend="ital">a tongue, utterance, speech, language</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">largus opum, lingua melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilem benevolumque lingua tua jam tibi me reddidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tu tibi istam praetruncari linguam largiloquam jubes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latium beare divite linguā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua quasi flabello seditionis contionem ventilare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam continere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:602" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae solutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam solvere ad jurgia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam operarii linguā celeri et exercitatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:18:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 18, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vitemus linguas hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetolorum linguas retundere,</quote> <trans><tr>to check their tongues, bring them to silence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">claudente noxarum conscientiā linguam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mihi lingua foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vati noceat mala lingua futuro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 28</bibl></cit>: favete linguis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">give attention</hi>, "<hi rend="ital">be silent that you may hear</hi>," <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:71" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguis animisque faventes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:83" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam lingua mali pars pessima servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedem imponere linguae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to speak for pay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usum linguae reciperare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguā debili esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to stammer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—Comically: os habeat, linguam, perfidiam, <hi rend="ital">tongue</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">readiness in speech</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 33</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n26692.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The tongue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">language</hi> of a people: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua Latina, Graeca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeca et Latina lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Massilia) tam procul a Graecorum regionibus, disciplinis linguāque divisa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod quidem Latina lingua sic observat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 44, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallicae linguae scientiam habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ipsorum lingua Celtae, nostra Galli, appellantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimili linguā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguā utrāque,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Greek and Latin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 23</bibl></cit>; so, auctores utriusque linguae, Quint. prooem. 1; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 1, 14: Mithridates, cui duas et viginti linguas notas fuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud rudis Graecae linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:11:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:4" default="NO">5, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syrus in Tiberim Orontes et linguam et mores vexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26692.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Dialect, idiom, mode of speech</hi> (post-Aug.): illis non verborum modo, sed. linguarum etiam se inter differentium copia est. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crassus quinque Graeci sermonis differentias sic tenuit, ut, qua quisque apud eum linguā postulasset, eadem jus sibi redditum ferret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utar enim historicā linguā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si philosophorum linguā uti voluissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26692.6" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of animals. <hi rend="ital">the voice, note, song, bark</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae volucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 361</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>, <cb n="LINO" /> 177: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam praecludere (canis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 22, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26692.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An utterance, expression</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua secretior,</quote> <trans><tr>a dark saying</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26692.8" n="B" level="2"> Of tongue-shaped things. </sense><sense id="n26692.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A plant, also called</hi> lingulaca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 108, § 170</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26692.10" n="2" level="3"> Lingua bubula, <hi rend="ital">a plant, oxtongue, bugloss</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 112</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26692.11" n="3" level="3"> Lingua canina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 18 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and lingua canis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 96</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">the plant hound's-tongue, also called</hi> cynoglossos; q. v.—</sense><sense id="n26692.12" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A tongue of land</hi>: id promontorium, Cujus lingua in altum proicit, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua in altum mille passuum excurrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 31, 9</bibl></cit>; Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 15, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eminet in altum lingua, in qua urbs sita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuem producit in aequora linguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 614</bibl></cit>; cf.: lingua dicitur promontorii genus non excellentis sed molliter in planum devexi, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=121" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 121</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n26692.13" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A spoonful</hi>, as a measure, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 73, § 119</bibl> (al. lingulis).—</sense><sense id="n26692.14" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The tongue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reed</hi> of a flute, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26692.15" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The short arm</hi> of a lever: <cit><quote lang="la">vectis lingua sub onus subdita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl></cit> (cf. ligula, VII.).</sense></entryFree>
linguarium: <entryFree id="n26693" type="hapax" key="lingua_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">linguārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lingua</etym>, <sense id="n26693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tonguemoney;</hi> a comic expression to denote a penalty for rash sayings: <cit><quote lang="la">linguarium dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:36:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 36, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
linguatulus: <entryFree id="n26694" type="main" key="lingua_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">linguātŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [linguatus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat gifted with a tongue, sub-eloquent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
linguatus: <entryFree id="n26695" type="main" key="lingua_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">linguātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lingua</etym>, <sense id="n26695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gifted with a tongue, eloquent</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
linguax: <entryFree id="n26696" type="hapax" key="linguax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">linguax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loquacious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lingula: <entryFree id="n26697" type="main" key="lingu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lingŭla</orth>, v. ligula.</entryFree>
lingulaca: <entryFree id="n26698" type="main" key="lingu^la_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lingŭlāca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> <etym>lingula</etym>. <sense id="n26698.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Comm., a gossip, chatterbox</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (uxor) lingulaca est nobis: numquam tacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 62</bibl></cit>: lingulacae obtrectatores, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 26, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26698.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> </sense><sense id="n26698.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of fish, a sole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=77" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 77</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=117" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 117</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n26698.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi> (perhaps Ranunculus lingua, Linn.), <hi rend="ital">the marsh crowfoot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 84, § 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lingulatus: <entryFree id="n26699" type="main" key="lingu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lingŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tongueshaped, lingulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 34, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lingulus: <entryFree id="n26700" type="main" key="lingu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lingŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">talkative, quarrelsome</hi>, Poët. ap. Wernsdorf. <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> Lat. Min. 2, p. 237.</sense></entryFree>
linguositas: <entryFree id="n26701" type="main" key="linguo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">linguōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lingua</etym>, <sense id="n26701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loquacity</hi>, (late Lat.), Rust. c. Aceph. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
linguosus: <entryFree id="n26702" type="main" key="linguo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">linguōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">talkative, loquacious</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26702.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">durae buccae fuit, linguosus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 43, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">63, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108</bibl></cit>, n. 20.—</sense><sense id="n26702.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">expressive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orchestarum linguosi digiti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 4, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
liniamentum: <entryFree id="n26703" type="main" key="li_ni^a_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĭāmentum</orth>, v. lineamentum.</entryFree>
liniatura: <entryFree id="n26704" type="gloss" key="li^ni^a_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭnĭātūra</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">xri/sis</foreign> (<sense id="n26704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an anointing</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
linifer: <entryFree id="n26705" type="gloss" key="li_ni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>linum-fero</etym>. <sense id="n26705.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Flaxbearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 14, 28, § 90</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26705.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of</hi> Silvanus, Inscr. ap. Murat. 70. 6.</sense></entryFree>
linifiarius: <entryFree id="n26706" type="main" key="li_ni^fi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĭfĭārĭus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">līnĭfĭo</orth>, v. linyphiarius.</entryFree>
linificus: <entryFree id="n26707" type="main" key="li_ni^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>linum-facio</etym>, <sense id="n26707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a linenweaver</hi>, Cod. Th. 8, 16.</sense></entryFree>
liniger: <entryFree id="n26708" type="main" key="li_ni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>linum gero</etym>, <sense id="n26708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">linen-wearing, clothed in linen;</hi> of Isis and her priests: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:747" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 747</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu fuge linigerae Memphitica templa juvencae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grege linigero circumdatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:532" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 532</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
linimen: <entryFree id="n26709" type="main" key="li^ni_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭnīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lino</etym>, <sense id="n26709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro linimine adhibere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
linimentum: <entryFree id="n26710" type="main" key="li^ni_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭnīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smearing-stuff, liniment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limpidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:34" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
linio: <entryFree id="n26711" type="main" key="li^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. lino.</entryFree>
liniphiarius: <entryFree id="n26712" type="main" key="li_ni^phi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĭphĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. linyphiarius.</entryFree>
liniphio: <entryFree id="n26713" type="main" key="li_ni^phi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnĭphĭo</orth>, <itype>onis</itype>, v. linyphio.</entryFree>
linitio: <entryFree id="n26714" type="main" key="li^ni_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭnītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lino</etym>, <sense id="n26714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an anointing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:38:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 38, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
linitus: <entryFree id="n26715" type="main" key="li^ni_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from linio, v. lino.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26716" type="main" key="li^ni_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭnītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>linio</etym>, <sense id="n26716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smearing, anointing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potu et linitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 12, 47, § 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lino: <entryFree id="n26717" type="main" key="li^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭno</orth>, <itype>lēvi</itype> (līvi), lĭtum, 3, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭnĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi</itype>, ītum. 4 (contr. form of the <sense id="n26717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. perf.</hi> lisse for livisse. <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 4</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> livi, Cato, <cb n="LINT" /> R. R. 69; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">levi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: lini for livi, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 898</bibl> P.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root li-, to let go, pour; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lib-, lei/bw</foreign>; cf. Lat. libo; hence, littera, 2. limus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to daub, besmear, anoint, to spread</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rub over</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26717.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerā Spiramenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicula vipereo felle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina linenda cedro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinum quod ego ipse testa Conditum levi (sc. pice),</quote> <trans><tr>which I have sealed with pitch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 8, 10</bibl> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quis plura linit victuro dolia musto?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:58" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picata opercula diligenter gypso linunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:16:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:481" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucis sagittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 711" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 711</bibl></cit>: cum relego, scripsisse pudet, qui plurima cerno, Me quoque, qui feci, judice digna lini, <hi rend="ital">that deserve to be rubbed out, erased</hi> (because the writing on a tablet was rubbed out with the broad end of the style), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 15</bibl>.—In the form linio, īre: <cit><quote lang="la">liquidā pice cum oleo linire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 10, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 28, 47, § 266</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectoria luto cum liniuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n26717.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To rub</hi> over something: linere medicamenta per corpora, Ov. Med. fac. 81.—</sense><sense id="n26717.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26717.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To overlay, cover</hi>: tecta auro, Ov. Med. fac. 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:62:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 62, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26717.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bedaub, bemire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linit ora luto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:760" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 760</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:22:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 22, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26717.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to befoul</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmine foedo Splendida facta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 237</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
linostema: <entryFree id="n26718" type="gloss" key="li^nostema"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭnostema</orth>, est vestis ex lana linoque contexta: <sense id="n26718.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">et dicta linostema, quia in stamine linum in trama lanam habet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
linostrophon: <entryFree id="n26719" type="greek" key="li^nostro^phon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭnostrŏphon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lino/strofon</foreign>, <sense id="n26719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, called also</hi> marrubium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 89, § 241</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
linozostis: <entryFree id="n26720" type="greek" key="li^nozo_stis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭnozōstis</orth>, <itype>is and ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lino/zwstis</foreign>, <sense id="n26720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, called also</hi> mercurialis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 18, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:124" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 12, 76, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:150" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 14, 89, § 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
linquo: <entryFree id="n26721" type="main" key="linquo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">linquo</orth>, <itype>līqui, 3</itype> (<sense id="n26721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part.</hi> lictus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aurel. 7</bibl> dub.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lip</foreign>- in <foreign lang="greek">lei/pw, loipo/s</foreign>; cf. Lat. licet</etym>. </sense><sense id="n26721.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To leave, quit, forsake, depart from</hi> something (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">destituo, desero): urbem exsul linquat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil intentatum nostri liquere poëtae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linquenda tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 14, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Absol., to go away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linquebat comite ancilla una,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:119" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26721.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n26721.3" n="1" level="3"> Linqui animo, and simply linqui, <hi rend="ital">to swoon, faint</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linquor et ancillis excipienda cado,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 130</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me liquit animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 623" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 623</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 363</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26721.4" n="2" level="3"> Linquere lumen, animam, vitam, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen linque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcia linquebant labentis lumina vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:989" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 989</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:542" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 542</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linquebant dulces animas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 522</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 13:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 13, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Poenum liquere doli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:38" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 38</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26721.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To leave, give up, resign, abandon</hi> something: <cit><quote lang="la">linquamus haec,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:10:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 10, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linquamus naturam, artesque videamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 46, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linque severa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:631" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inrita ventosae linquens promissa procellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26721.6" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To leave</hi> in any place or condition: <cit><quote lang="la">erum in opsidione linquet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupos apud oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26721.7" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To leave behind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linquere vacuos cultoribus agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui monumentum insigne pericli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:231" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetram hospitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:661" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 661</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26721.8" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: linquitur, <hi rend="ital">it is left, it remains</hi>.— With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: linquitur, ut totis animalibus adsimulentur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:914" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 914</bibl>: et vix cernere linquitur undas, Silv. 4, 628.</sense></entryFree>
linteamen: <entryFree id="n26722" type="main" key="linte^a_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lintĕāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>linteum</etym>, <sense id="n26722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a linen cloth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lotum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 261, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:24:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 24, 12 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
lintearius: <entryFree id="n26723" type="main" key="linte^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lintĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to linen, linen-</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26723.1" n="I" level="1"> Negotiatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:5:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26723.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lintĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a linen-weaver</hi>: linteariorum corpus, Cod. Th. 10, 20, 16; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:5:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4215</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
linteatus: <entryFree id="n26724" type="main" key="linte^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lintĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed in linen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:de Vit. Beat. 26:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> de Vit.
