Beat. 26, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">legio, a legion of Samnites, containing picked men,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 38, 12</bibl></cit> (v. the context): <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:41:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 41, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallio deae Isidis linteata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Test. Anim. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
linteo: <entryFree id="n26725" type="main" key="linte^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lintĕo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a linen-weaver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linteones Apollinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 38, 15</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1069" /> <cb n="LINU" /></sense></entryFree>
linteolum: <entryFree id="n26726" type="main" key="linte^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lintĕŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>linteum</etym>, <sense id="n26726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small linen cloth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosae folia tusa in linteolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:100" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 9, 45, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:30:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 30, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26726.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a lamp-wick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebrium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 5, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
linteolus: <entryFree id="n26727" type="hapax" key="linte^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lintĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [linteus], <hi rend="ital">linen-</hi>: palliolum, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 180.</sense></entryFree>
linter: <entryFree id="n26728" type="main" key="linter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">linter</orth>, <itype>tris</itype> (<case>nom.</case> lintris, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 283</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:34" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 34</bibl>) [old form lunter for plun-ter; root <foreign lang="greek">plu/nw</foreign>, to wash; cf. pluvia; hence] <sense id="n26728.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a wash-tub;</hi> or in gen., <hi rend="ital">a trough, vat, tray, tub</hi>, for wine, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavat arbore lintres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 262</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26728.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a boat, skiff, wherry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lintribus materiam in insulam convehere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novas (sc. lintres), cavare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 26</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: loqui e lintre, said of one who sways his body to and fro when speaking, Julius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:216" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 60, 216</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprehendenda et illa frequens et concitata in utramque partem nutatio, quam in Curione patre inrisit et Julius, quaerens, quis in luntre loqueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:129" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naviget hinc aliā jam mihi linter aquā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>let me now turn to something else</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:864" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 864</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in liquida nat tibi linter aquā,</quote> <trans><tr>you have a favorable opportunity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 37</bibl></cit> (1, 5, 76).</sense></entryFree>
linternum: <entryFree id="n26729" type="main" key="Linternum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Linternum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Liternum.</entryFree>
linteum: <entryFree id="n26730" type="main" key="linte^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lintĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>linum</etym>, <sense id="n26730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a linen cloth</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26730.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">linteum cape atque exterge tibi manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uncto linteo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linteum extersui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces linteis et vitro delatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succinctus linteo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus linteo colatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 103, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sella, linteisque lorisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:57:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 57, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lintea componit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:263" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 263</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26730.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26730.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Linen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarquinienses (polliciti sunt) lintea in vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26730.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum est dare lintea retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 686</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tibi sunt integra lintea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zephyri veniant in lintea pleni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 11, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26730.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A girdle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut qui quaerere velit, nudus quaerat, linteo cinctus, lancem habens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:section=192" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, § 192</bibl></cit>; cf. also licium.—</sense><sense id="n26730.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A curtain</hi>, used as a sign: <cit><quote lang="la">inscripta lintea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:168" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 168</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26730.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Stuff, cloth</hi>, other than linen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:38 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 10, 21, § 38 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
linteus: <entryFree id="n26731" type="main" key="linte^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lintĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">linen-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lintea vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56, § 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40</bibl></cit>: Lintei libri, <hi rend="ital">an ancient chronicle of the Roman people, which was written on linen, and preserved in the temple of Juno Moneta</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macer Auctor est et in foedere Ardeatino et in linteis libris ad Monetae inventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 20, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 23, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 38, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea publica monumenta plumbeis voluminibus mox et privata linteis confici coepta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 11, 21, § 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:34" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 1</bibl> and 8: thorax, <hi rend="ital">a linen breastplate</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">linoqw/rac</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 20, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loricae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,011:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iph. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lintrarius: <entryFree id="n26732" type="main" key="lintra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lintrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>linter</etym>, <sense id="n26732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boatman, waterman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:9:1:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 9, 1, § 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4245</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lintriculus: <entryFree id="n26733" type="hapax" key="lintri^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lintrĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small boat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wherry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 10, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lintris: <entryFree id="n26734" type="main" key="lintris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lintris</orth>, v. linter <sense id="n26734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
linum: <entryFree id="n26735" type="greek" key="li_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">li/non</foreign>; Goth. lein; Germ. Leinwand; Engl. linen</etym>, <sense id="n26735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flax.</hi> </sense><sense id="n26735.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">reticulum, tenuissimo lino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urit lini campum seges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19</bibl> prooem. § 2; <cit><quote lang="la">19, 1, 1, § 9: lino legato tam factum quam infectum continetur, quodque netum quodque in tela est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:70:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 70, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26735.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26735.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A thread</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuto vulnere, crassum atque recens linum ostendit non una cicatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:151" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 151</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">the thread with which letters were bound and legal instruments sealed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effer cito stilum, ceram et tabellas et linum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ceram et linum litterasque interpretes salutem mittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linum incidimus, legimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere vincula epistolae,</quote> <trans><tr>to open a letter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lino consignare tabulas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">easque tabulas proprio lino propriaque cera consignamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:181" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linum ruptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26735.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fishing line</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc in mole sedens moderabar arundine linum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:923" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 923</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26735.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A linen cloth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">garment, linen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massica Integrum perdunt lino vitiata saporem,</quote> <trans><tr>strained through linen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:519" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 519</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velati lino et verbena tempora cincti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lino vestiri aut lanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26735.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sail</hi>: lina sinu Tendere<cb n="LIPP" />  toto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 320" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 320</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26735.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A rope, cable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subducere carbasa lino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:587" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 587</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26735.8" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A net</hi> for hunting or fishing; <hi rend="ital">a hunter's net, toils</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">positarum lina plagarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 768</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec lina sequi nodosa sinebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:807" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 807</bibl></cit>; 3, 153.—<hi rend="ital">A fisher's net, drag-net</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:931" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 931</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymbae linique magister,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the fisherman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:503" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 503</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26735.9" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A linen corselet, habergeon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugit hasta per oras Multiplicis lini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:292" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora multiplici mos est defendere lino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:272" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thorax Multiplicis lini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:587" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 587</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26735.10" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A string of pearls</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno lino decies sestertium inseritur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26735.11" n="K" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lampwick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumigans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 42, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Jud. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
linus: <entryFree id="n26736" type="main" key="Li^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*li:nos</foreign>, <sense id="n26736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Linus</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26736.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Apollo and Psammate, daughter of Crotopus, king of the Argives; he was given by his mother to the care of shepherds, and one day, being left alone, was torn to pieces by dogs; whereupon Apollo sent into the land a monster which destroyed everything, until slain by Chorœbus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:64" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 557</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n26736.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The son of Apollo and Terpsichore, instructor of Orpheus and Hercules, the latter of whom killed him by a blow with the lyre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flam, ut ego opinor, Hercules, tu autem Linus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 10</bibl> (3, 4), 8, who confounds him with the preceding. According to others, <hi rend="ital">he was a son of Mercury and Urania, and was killed by Apollo in Eubœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 161" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:86:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 86, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26736.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fountain in Arcadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 7, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
linyphus: <entryFree id="n26737" type="greek" key="li_ny^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līnyphus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">līnĭf-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">līnyphĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">līnĭf-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">līnyphĭārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">līnĭf-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lino/u+fos, linou+fh/s</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">li:nufos</foreign>, Gloss.), <sense id="n26737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a linen-weaver</hi> (post-class.): Scythopolitani linyphi, Cod. Th. 10, 20, 8: alii linyphiones sunt, Hadr. in Ep. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Sat. 8</bibl>: corpus linyphiariorum, Cod. Th. 10, 20, 16.</sense></entryFree>
lio: <entryFree id="n26738" type="greek" key="li_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">leio/w, leiw=</foreign>, <sense id="n26738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make smooth, plaster over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cisternam liare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:1:section=186" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 5, 1, § 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liostrea: <entryFree id="n26739" type="main" key="li_ostre^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līostrĕa</orth>, v. leiostrea.</entryFree>
liothasius: <entryFree id="n26740" type="main" key="li_o^tha^si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līŏthăsĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">leiŏthăsĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">lei=os-*qa/sios</foreign>, <sense id="n26740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of turnip</hi>, which perh. came from Thasus, and was more delicate than the others, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 25, § 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lipara: <entryFree id="n26741" type="main" key="Li^pa^ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭpăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭpărē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lipa/rh</foreign>, <sense id="n26741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Æolian isles, to the north of Sicily, with a city of the same name</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lipari</hi>.—Form Lipara, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 9, 14, § 93</bibl>.—Form Lipare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 417</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:96" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 96</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭpărae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai( *lipa/rai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Liparian</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Æolic Islands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9, 11</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n26741.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭpăraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Liparæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liparaei nitor Hebri,</quote> <trans><tr>from Lipara</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taberna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Vulcan's smithy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:45" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 45</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭpăraei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Liparæans</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liparaeorum insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26741.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭpăren-sis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Liparæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:37:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 37, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piratae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 28</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭpăren-ses</orth> (old form lepareses Liparitani cives, id est Liparenses, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=121" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 121</bibl> Müll.), <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Liparæans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:37:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 37, § 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26741.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭpărītānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Liparitan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26741.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭpărītāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Liparitans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext</hi>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26742" type="main" key="li^pa^ra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭpăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">liparo/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n26742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an emollient plaster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 9, 81, § 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:110" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 6, 35, § 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:174" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 18, 53, § 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liparea: <entryFree id="n26743" type="main" key="li^pa^re^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭpărĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 62, § 172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 16, 15, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liparis: <entryFree id="n26744" type="main" key="Li^pa^ris1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭpăris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lipari/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Cilician river near the town of Soli, the water of which is of an oleaginous quality</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26745" type="spur" key="li^pa^ris2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭpăris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, a false reading for lelepris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>.</entryFree>
liparitanus: <entryFree id="n26746" type="main" key="Li^pa^ri_ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭpărītānus</orth>, v. 1. Lipara, C.</entryFree>
liparo: <entryFree id="n26747" type="main" key="Li^pa^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭpăro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">king of Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lipio: <entryFree id="n26748" type="main" key="li^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>ĭre</itype>, <sense id="n26748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to croak</hi>, of the kite: milvus lipit, Auct. Carm. Philom. 24.</sense></entryFree>
lippesco: <entryFree id="n26749" type="main" key="lippesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lippesco</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n26749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to become blear-eyed</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Sophon. 3, 49</bibl>. <cb n="LIQU" /></sense></entryFree>
lippidus: <entryFree id="n26750" type="gloss" key="lippi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lippĭdus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">glamw/dhs</foreign> (i. q. lippus), Gloss. Gr. Lat.</entryFree>
lippio: <entryFree id="n26751" type="main" key="lippi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lippĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>lippus</etym>, <sense id="n26751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to haw watery</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inflamed eyes, to be blear-eyed</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26751.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: cum leviter lippirem, has litteras dedi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne omnino lippiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calor adjuvat lippientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 128</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n26751.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lippiunt fauces fame,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>burn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lippitudo: <entryFree id="n26752" type="main" key="lippi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lippĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blearedness, rheum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inflammation of the eyes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab lippitudine usque siccitas ut sit tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 182</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diuturna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 47, § 169</bibl></cit>; cf. arida, i. q. <foreign lang="greek">chrofqalmi/a</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lippitudines arcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 11, 47, § 125</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lipposus: <entryFree id="n26753" type="main" key="lippo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lippōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., blear-eyed</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Serm. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lippulus: <entryFree id="n26754" type="hapax" key="li^ppu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭppŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [lippus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat blear-eyed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 240</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lippus: <entryFree id="n26755" type="main" key="lippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lippus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. lip, to smear; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">li/pa, li/pos</foreign>, fat; <foreign lang="greek">a)/leifa</foreign>, salve; whence adeps</etym>, <sense id="n26755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blear-eyed, bleared, inflamed</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26755.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">num tibi lippus videor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(matrem) cubare in navi lippam atque oculis turgidis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit> lippi illic oculi seruos est simillimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tamen idcirco contemnas lippus inungi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lippus Illinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 30</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus et lippis notum et tonsoribus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to everybody</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26755.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26755.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dim-sighted, nearly blind, half-blind, purblind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuligine lippus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:130" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:79" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26755.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dropping, running</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lippa sub attrita fronte lacuna putet, of an empty eye-socket,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:59:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 59, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <trans><tr>an over-ripe fig, dropping with juice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:20:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 20, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26755.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">blind</hi> to one's own faults: <cit><quote lang="la">vappa et lippus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:76" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lips: <entryFree id="n26756" type="main" key="Lips"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lips</orth>, v. Libs.</entryFree>
liquabilis: <entryFree id="n26757" type="main" key="li^qua_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>liquo</etym>, <sense id="n26757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be melted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dissolved</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 293, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the pillar of salt into which Lot's wife was turned</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 744</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
liquamen: <entryFree id="n26758" type="main" key="li^qua_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a liquid mixture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo liquamine tonsa ovis imbuitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26758.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26758.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sauce</hi> made of fish-fat, <hi rend="ital">fish-sauce</hi> (cf. garum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 25, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26758.3" n="B" level="2"> = lixivium, <hi rend="ital">lye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13:167" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13, 167</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liquamentum: <entryFree id="n26759" type="main" key="li^qua_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mixture, concoction</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 66, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liquaminarius: <entryFree id="n26760" type="gloss" key="li^qua_mi^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquāmĭnārĭus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">garopw/lhs</foreign> (<sense id="n26760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who prepares</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sells fish-sauce</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
liquaminatus: <entryFree id="n26761" type="main" key="li^qua_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquāmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>liquamen</etym>, <sense id="n26761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with gravy, having gravy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
liquaminosus: <entryFree id="n26762" type="main" key="li^qua_mi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquāmĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of gravy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 5</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
liquarius: <entryFree id="n26763" type="gloss" key="li^qua_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>liquo</etym>, <sense id="n26763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to liquids</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensurae,</quote> <trans><tr>measures for liquids, liquid measures</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4344</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
liquatio: <entryFree id="n26764" type="hapax" key="li^qua_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a melting</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 46, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liquatorium: <entryFree id="n26765" type="main" key="li^qua_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a filter, strain er</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:39:229" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 39, 229</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liquefacio: <entryFree id="n26766" type="main" key="li^que^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <sense id="n26766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass</hi>. <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquĕfīo</orth> (<hi rend="ital">e</hi> long, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:178" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 178</bibl>), factus, fĭĕri [liqueo-facio], <hi rend="ital">to make liquid, to melt, dissolve, liquefy</hi> (class.; but in <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> very rare). </sense><sense id="n26766.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">glacies liquefacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum aera liquefacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquefactum plumbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 588</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa (Aetnae),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>lava</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sol liquefaciat ceram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 14, 49, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sevum liquefieri prius jubent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 38, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">margaritas aceto liquefactas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cibos mansos ac prope liquefactos demittimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26766.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">part. perf., dissolved, putrefied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecā medullae Tabe liquefactae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquefacta boum per viscera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 555</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26766.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26766.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To weaken, enervate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos nullae futtiles laetitiae exsultantes languidis liquefaciunt voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic mea perpetuis liquefiunt pectora curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:57" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26766.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To soften. melt</hi>: Bacchi dona volunt epulasque<pb n="1070" /> <cb n="LIQU" />  et carmina rursus Pieria liquefacta lyra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:416" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 416</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liquefactio: <entryFree id="n26767" type="main" key="li^que^facti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquĕfactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = liquatio (late Lat.), Inc. Auct. de Tripl. Habit. 2.</entryFree>
liquefactus: <entryFree id="n26768" type="main" key="li^que^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquĕfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from liquefacio.</entryFree>
liquefio: <entryFree id="n26769" type="main" key="li^que^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquĕfīo</orth>, v. liquefacio <sense id="n26769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
liquens: <entryFree id="n26770" type="main" key="li^quens1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquens</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from liqueo.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n26771" type="main" key="li_quens2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līquens</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from liquor.</entryFree>
liquentia: <entryFree id="n26772" type="main" key="Li^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Venetia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Livenza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 126</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 679</bibl>; Cod. Th. 11, 10, 2.</sense></entryFree>
liqueo: <entryFree id="n26773" type="main" key="li^que^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquĕo</orth>, <itype>līqui or licui, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. rik-, riktas, empty; Zend, ric-, to pour out; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lip</foreign>- in <foreign lang="greek">lei/pw</foreign>; cf. linquo</etym>, <sense id="n26773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be fluid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">liquid</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26773.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only in the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">lac est omnium rerum liquentium maxime alibile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina liquentia fundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum ac terras camposque liquentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 724</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvium liquentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 442</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26773.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be clear</hi>: polus liquet, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 88. —</sense><sense id="n26773.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be clear, manifest, apparent, evident</hi> (class., but used for the most part only in the <hi rend="ital">third pers. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid incerti mihi in animo prius aut ambiguum fuit, Nunc liquet, nunc defaecatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut liqueant omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc non liquet nec satis cogitatum est, utrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Protagoras sese negat omnino de deis habere, quod liqueat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (Protagorae) neutrum licuerit, nec esse deos nec non esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te liquet esse meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:62" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si liquerit eum vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:3:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidei purae liquentisque (opp. turbidae, ambiguae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:5:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26773.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: non liquet, <hi rend="ital">it doth not appear</hi>, a legal formula by which the judge declared that he was unable to decide respecting the guilt or innocence of the accused.—Hence also, in gen., <hi rend="ital">it is not evident, it is doubtful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non liquere dixerunt (judices),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 28, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum id de quo Panaetio non liquet, reliquis ejusdem disciplinae solis luce videatur clarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juravi, mihi non liquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non liquet mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:97" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 97</bibl></cit>.—So, on the contrary, liquet: <cit><quote lang="la">cum causam non audisset, dixit sibi liquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid maxime liquere judici velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo liquet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si liquebit mundum providentia regi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabatur, id. cuiquam pro percepto liquere, stellas istas non esse plures, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
liquesco: <entryFree id="n26774" type="main" key="li^quesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquesco</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lĭcŭi</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n26774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [liqueo], <hi rend="ital">to become fluid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">liquid, to melt</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26774.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabes nivis liquescentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ut cera liquescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 431</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volnificusque chalybs vastā fornace liquescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 446</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 59, § 162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora foeda jacent ... dilapsa liquescunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>putrefy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 550</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26774.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26774.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To become clear, limpid</hi>: aqua liquescit ac subsidit, Auct. B. Alex. 5.—</sense><sense id="n26774.4" n="2" level="3"> Of the liquid sound of <hi rend="ital">l, m, n, r</hi> with other consonants, <hi rend="ital">to merge, coalesce, be confined with</hi> other sounds: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum sonus liquescit et tenuatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0996,001:page=1389" default="NO"><author>Val. Prob.</author> p. 1389</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n26774.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26774.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To grow soft, effeminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua (voluptate) cum liquescimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 52</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26774.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To melt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">waste away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna liquescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:425" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 425</bibl></cit>.—Of a person: <cit><quote lang="la">minui et deperire, et, ut proprie dicam, liquescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
liquet: <entryFree id="n26775" type="main" key="li^quet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquet</orth>, v. liqueo.</entryFree>
liquide: <entryFree id="n26776" type="main" key="li^qui^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. liquidus <sense id="n26776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
liquiditas: <entryFree id="n26777" type="hapax" key="li^qui^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>liquidus</etym>, <sense id="n26777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">liquidity</hi>: aëris, App. de Mundo, p. 57, 13.</sense></entryFree>
liquidiusculus: <entryFree id="n26778" type="hapax" key="li^qui^di^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquĭdĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. comp. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">somewhat more fluid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">soft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquidiusculusque ero, quam ventus est Favonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 71</bibl></cit>; v. Brix ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
liquido: <entryFree id="n26779" type="main" key="li^qui^do_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquĭdō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. liquidus <sense id="n26779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
liquidus: <entryFree id="n26780" type="main" key="li_^qui^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lī^quĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (the first syll. usually short; long in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 349</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:427" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 427</bibl>; while in the line <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1259</bibl> it is used both as long and short; <sense id="n26780.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>liqueo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">flowing, fluid, liquid</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26780.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua bona et liquida,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crassaque conveniant liquidis et liquida crassis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquida moles,</quote> <trans><tr>the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <trans><tr>a voyage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit> (4, 21), 14: <cit><quote lang="la">palaestra (because there liquid unguents were used),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odores,</quote> <trans><tr>liquid unguents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: sorores, <hi rend="ital">fountain-nymphs</hi>, Ov. M. <cb n="LIQU" /> 1, 704: <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <trans><tr>loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus,</quote> <trans><tr>watery, loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lī^quĭdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a liquid, water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi si sit opus liquidi non amplius urna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum liquido mixtā polentā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 454</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26780.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">clear, bright, transparent, limpid, pure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquidior lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquidissima caeli tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 59</bibl></cit>: iter, <hi rend="ital">serene way</hi> (through the air), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 217</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26780.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp. of sounds. </sense><sense id="n26780.4" n="(a)" level="5"> Of the voice: vox, <hi rend="ital">a clear voice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">song</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">variae volucres liquidis loca vocibus opplent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 410</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui liquidam pater Vocem cum cithara dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen citharae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:981" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 981</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26780.5" n="(b)" level="5"> Liquidae consonantes, <hi rend="ital">the liquids</hi>, i. e. the letters <hi rend="ital">l, m, n, r</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 13</bibl>: liquidae dictae sunt (litterae) quia liquescunt in metro aliquoties et pereunt, Cledon. p. 1882 P. al.; cf. liquesco, I. B. 2.—</sense><sense id="n26780.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26780.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Flowing, continuing without interruption</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 159</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26780.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Clear, calm, serene, peaceful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam liquidus est, quam liquida esse tempestas solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo liquido et tranquillo es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquido's animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:16" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26780.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unmixed, unadulterated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quicquid inde haurias, purum liquidumque te haurire sentias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 27, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas liquida puraque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas et libera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26780.10" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Clear, evident, certain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 72</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lī^quĭdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">clearness, certainty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redigere aliquid ad liquidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:32" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad liquidum confessumque perducere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ad liquidum ratione perducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:16:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭ-quĭdō</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26780.11" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum liquide serenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:21:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquidius audiunt talpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 69, 88, § 191</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26780.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Clearly, plainly, evidently, certainly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid liquido audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:59:section=136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 59, § 136</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">confirmare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 56</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">124: negare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si liquido appareat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:5:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si liquido constiterit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:4:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 29, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—In the form liquide: <cit><quote lang="la">consistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquidius judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquidius facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:12:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 12, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid liquidius absolvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquidissime atque invictissime defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 28" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
liquiritia: <entryFree id="n26781" type="greek" key="li^qui^ri_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquĭrītĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>corrupted fr. <foreign lang="greek">glukurri/za</foreign> = glycyrrhiza, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n26781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">liquorice</hi>, Theod. de Diaet. 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liquis: <entryFree id="n26782" type="hapax" key="li_quis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līquis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>the simple word, whence obliquus</etym>, <sense id="n26782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oblique</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Expos. Form. p. 32" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Expos. Form. p. 32</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
liquo: <entryFree id="n26783" type="main" key="li^quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n26783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to make liquid, to melt, dissolve, liquefy</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26783.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 66, § 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis liquatur igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 8, 13, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquatum aes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 13, 36, § 134</bibl></cit>: liquatae guttae, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 10, 25.—</sense><sense id="n26783.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to strain, filter, clarify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina liques,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquatum vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 37, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquatae aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 3, 22, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saccus, quo vinum liquatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silicem rivo saliente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 534</bibl></cit>: voces liquatae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">clear voices</hi>, Auct. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n26783.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make clear, simplify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (verba) cum sex et viginti natus annos summis audientium clamoribus dixerit, defervisse tempore et annis liquata jam senior idem fatetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
liquor: <entryFree id="n26784" type="main" key="li_quor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līquor</orth>, <itype>līqui</itype> (<sense id="n26784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> liquier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Trag. Brut. 28" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Trag. Brut. 28</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [liqueo], <hi rend="ital">to be fluid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">liquid, to flow, melt, dissolve</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n26784.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum toto corpore sudor Liquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:813" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 813</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic (arbori) atro liquuntur sanguine guttae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquentia flumina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fraces et amurca liquentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 6, 6, § 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26784.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to melt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">waste away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilico res foras labitur, liquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in partem pejorem liquitur aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1132</bibl></cit>: per poli liquentis axem, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 88.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26785" type="main" key="li^quor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭquor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype> (lī, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 454</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>liqueo</etym>, <sense id="n26785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fluidness, fluidity, liquidity</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26785.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cb n="LIS" /> liquor aquai, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 454</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae, quae vim habent frigoris et caloris, concretionis et liquoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomica liquoris aeterni argentum vivum appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 32, § 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26785.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a fluid, liquid</hi>, liquoris vitigeni latex, <hi rend="ital">wine</hi>, Lucr, 5, 14: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis flavusque mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1:938" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 938</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquores amnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stygius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:594" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 594</bibl></cit>: Virgineus, <hi rend="ital">the water of the spring</hi> Virgo (v. Virgo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 8, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea tunc pressos pedibus dedit uva liquores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: fluidus, <hi rend="ital">a corrupt moisture</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">putrefaction</hi>, = tabes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 484</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(teritur) parvo saepe liquore silex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit> (3, 20), 16: <cit><quote lang="la">Assyrius, i. e. amomum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:212" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">niveus lactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 565" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 51, § 179</bibl></cit>. —Of the sea: <cit><quote lang="la">qua medius liquor Secernit Europen ab Afro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lira: <entryFree id="n26786" type="main" key="li_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. fr. lisa; O. H. Germ. Leisa; Germ. Geleise, a track or rut; cf. delirus</etym>, <sense id="n26786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the earth thrown up between two furrows, a ridge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liras rustici vocant easdem porcas, cum sic aratum est, ut inter duos latius distantes sulcos medius cumulus siccam sedem frumentis praebeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patentes liras facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscissa lira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26786.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a furrow</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 17, 32</bibl>; cf. lira, <foreign lang="greek">au)=lac</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
liratim: <entryFree id="n26787" type="hapax" key="li_ra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līrātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>lira</etym>, <sense id="n26787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by furrows</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liratim serere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lirenas: <entryFree id="n26788" type="main" key="Li_re_nas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Līrēnas</orth>, v. Liris, II.</entryFree>
lirinas: <entryFree id="n26789" type="main" key="Li_ri_nas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Līrīnas</orth>, v. Liris, II.</entryFree>
lirinensis: <entryFree id="n26790" type="main" key="Li_ri_nensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Līrīnensis</orth>, v. Lirinus, II.</entryFree>
lirinon: <entryFree id="n26791" type="greek" key="li_ri^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līrĭnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lei/rinon</foreign>, <sense id="n26791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oil of lilies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:95" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 4, 49, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lirinus: <entryFree id="n26792" type="main" key="Li_ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Līrīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lērīna</orth>, ae), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lhri/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n26792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island on the coast of</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">opposite to</hi> Antipolis (the modern Antibes), now <hi rend="ital">St. Honorat</hi> (one of the islands <hi rend="ital">De Le´rins</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 16, 104</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n26792.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Līrīnensis</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lirinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cenobium Lirinense,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lirion: <entryFree id="n26793" type="greek" key="li_ri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līrĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lei/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n26793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lily</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liriope: <entryFree id="n26794" type="main" key="Li_ri^o^pe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Līrĭŏpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain-nymph, the mother of Narcissus by Cephisus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 342</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liris: <entryFree id="n26795" type="main" key="Li_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Līris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river between Latium and Campania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Garigliano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:227:3:5:9:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 227, 3, 5, 9, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 424</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lirem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lirim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lirin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 56</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26795.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Līrī-nas</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Līrēnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Liris</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interamnates Succasini, qui et Lirenates vocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
liro: <entryFree id="n26796" type="main" key="li_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lira</etym>, <sense id="n26796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to plough</hi> or <hi rend="ital">harrow in</hi> the seed. </sense><sense id="n26796.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram cum primum arant, proscindere appellant: cum iterum, offringere dicunt: tertio cum arant jacto semine, lirare dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R.
