R. 1:29:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (iteratio) quoque ubi consuetudo patitur, crate dentata, vel tabula aratro adnexa, quod vocant lirare, operiente semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 20, 49, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lirantur una jugera quatuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:47" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 47</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n26796.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to scratch</hi> one's lips: alicui labias, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 18, 5</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n26796.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, for delirare, <hi rend="ital">to be mad, to rave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et si Pierias patitur lirare sorores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 10, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
liroe: <entryFree id="n26797" type="greek" key="li_roe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līroe</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>) = <foreign lang="greek">lh=roi</foreign>, <sense id="n26797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trifles, bagatelles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerrae germanae, atque edepol liroe liroe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lis: <entryFree id="n26798" type="main" key="li_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līs</orth>, <itype>lītis</itype> (old form stlis, stlitis, like stlocus for locus; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 16</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root star-, in sterno; cf. Germ. streiten, to contend</etym>, <sense id="n26798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strife, dispute, quarrel</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26798.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis pugnam expectat, litis contrahat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi aetatem in litibus conterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammatici certant et adhuc sub judice lis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsus litibus alternis dati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 39: <cit><quote lang="la">semper habet lites alternaque jurgia lectus In quo nupta jacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:268" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 268</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">lis est cum formā magna pudicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 288</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 107</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n26798.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26798.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A charge, an accusation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipito hanc tute ad te litem ... Fac ego ne metuam mihi, atque ut tu meam timeas vicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 23</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26798.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A lawsuit, an action</hi> or <hi rend="ital">process</hi> at law: <cit><quote lang="la">nam mihi tris hodie litis judicandas dicito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: hodie juris coctiores <pb n="1071" /> <cb n="LITE" /> non sunt, qui litis creant, Quam sunt hice, qui, si nihil est litium, litis serunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:9 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 9 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:28:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 28, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetere ac persequi lite atque judicio aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:13:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 13, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litem alicui intendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in inferendis litibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contestari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtinere aut amittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3</bibl></cit>. 10, 43: <cit><quote lang="la">sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:57:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 57, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:30" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in litibus aestimandis,</quote> <trans><tr>in suits for damages</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:41:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 41, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lis capitis,</quote> <trans><tr>a prosecution involving life, a capital charge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:41:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 41, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestimationem litium non esse judicium,</quote> <trans><tr>an appraisal of damages</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in eum litis aestimares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vulgo dicitur, e lege Julia litem anno et sex mensibus mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:104" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 104</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26798.5" n="2" level="3"> In the phrase: litem suam facere, <hi rend="ital">to make the cause his own</hi>, said, </sense><sense id="n26798.6" n="(a)" level="5"> Litem suam facere, of an advocate who neglects the cause of his client and seeks his own advantage: <cit><quote lang="la">quid, si cum pro altero dicas, litem tuam facias?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:75:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 75, 305</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26798.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Also of a judge who, out of favor or through bribery, pronounces an unjust sentence, or who turns aside from the questions strictly before him to express his own opinions or feelings through the judgment: debet enim judex attendere, ut cum certae pecuniae condemnatio posita sit, neque majoris neque minoris summa petita nummo condemnet, alioquin litem suam facit; <cit><quote lang="la">item si taxatio posita sit, ne pluris condemnet quam taxatum sit, alias enim similiter litem suam facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:52" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si judex litem suam fecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:7:4:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 7, 4, § 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:15" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 1, 15</bibl>; so, trop.: nam et Varro satis aperte, quid dicere oporteret, edocuit; <cit><quote lang="la">et ego adversus eum, qui doctus esse dicebatur, litem meam facere absens nolui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26798.8" n="(g)" level="5"> Also of a judge who does not appear on the day appointed: inde ad comitium vadunt, ne litem suam faciant, C. Titius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26798.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The subject of an action at law, the matter in dispute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus res erat in controversia, ea vocabatur lis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=93" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 93</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">illud mihi mirum videri solet, tot homines statuere non potuisse, utrum rem an litem dici oporteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lites severe aestimatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo minus secundum eas tabulas lis detur, non recusamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tota lite pactionem facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suam rem litem vertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litem lite resolvere,</quote> <trans><tr>to explain one obscure thing by another equally so</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lissus: <entryFree id="n26799" type="main" key="Lissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lissus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lissum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lisso/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in southern Dalmatia, on the borders of Macedonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Alessio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 26, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:30" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
litabilis: <entryFree id="n26800" type="main" key="li^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lito</etym>, <sense id="n26800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fit for sacrifice, with which a successful offering can be made</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">victima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litabilior victima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
litamen: <entryFree id="n26801" type="main" key="li^ta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭtāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacrifice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema litamina divum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:610" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 610</bibl></cit>: cujus litamen sordet, Prud. Hamart. praef. 50.</sense></entryFree>
litana: <entryFree id="n26802" type="main" key="Li^ta_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭtāna silva</orth>, or <sense id="n26802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭtāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a forest in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">which extended through Liguria and Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Selva de Luogo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 24, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 42, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 6</bibl>.—Form Litana, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
litania: <entryFree id="n26803" type="greek" key="li^ta^ni_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭtănīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">litanei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n26803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public form of prayer to God, a litany</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litanias facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; Cod. 1, 5, 6.</sense></entryFree>
litatio: <entryFree id="n26804" type="main" key="li^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lito</etym>, <sense id="n26804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortunate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">successful sacrifice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per dies aliquot hostiae majores sine litatione caesae, diuque non impetrata pax deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 15, 4</bibl></cit>; Inscr. Fratr. Arval. ap. Orell. 2271.</sense></entryFree>
litato: <entryFree id="n26805" type="main" key="li^ta_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭtātō</orth>, <sense id="n26805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>, v lito, I. A.</sense></entryFree>
litera: <entryFree id="n26806" type="main" key="li_te^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lītĕra</orth>, v. littera.</entryFree>
liternum: <entryFree id="n26807" type="main" key="Li_ternum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Līternum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lint-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n26807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Campania, situated to the north of the mouth of the river Liternus</hi>, now the village of <hi rend="ital">Patria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 714</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:654" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 654</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:533" default="NO">8, 533</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n26807.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Līternus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Literman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liternus ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:654" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 654</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Līternum</orth> (sc. <cb n="LITI" /> praedium), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an estate of Scipio Africanus, near Liternum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26807.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Līternīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Liternian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 49</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lī-ternīnum</orth> (sc. praedium), <hi rend="ital">an estate of Scipio Africanus, near Liternum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
literosus: <entryFree id="n26808" type="main" key="li_te^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lītĕrōsus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lītĕrŭla</orth>, etc., v. litterosus, litterula, etc.</entryFree>
lithanicus: <entryFree id="n26809" type="greek" key="li^tha_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭthānĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">liqia/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n26809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one suffering from the stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 87, § 239</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lithargyrus: <entryFree id="n26810" type="greek" key="li^thargy^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭthargyrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">liqa/rguros</foreign>, <sense id="n26810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the spume of silver, litharge, the semivitreous protoxide of lead</hi> (pure Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">spuma argenti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 64, § 101</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lithizon: <entryFree id="n26811" type="greek" key="li^thi_zon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭthīzon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">liqi/zwn</foreign> (stonelike): lithizontes, a reading for lignyizontes, in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 95</bibl>.</entryFree>
lithospermon: <entryFree id="n26812" type="greek" key="li^thospermon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭthospermon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">liqo/spermon</foreign>, <sense id="n26812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, stone-crop, gromwell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 74, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lithostrotus: <entryFree id="n26813" type="greek" key="li^thostro_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭthostrōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">liqo/strwtos</foreign>, <sense id="n26813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inlaid with stones, mosaic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26813.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭthostrōtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">mosaicwork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 60, § 184</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 32, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lithotomia: <entryFree id="n26814" type="greek" key="li^tho^to^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭthŏtŏmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">liqotomi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n26814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lithotomy, the cutting out of a stone from the bladder</hi>, cael. Aur. Tard. 5, 4, 77.</sense></entryFree>
liticen: <entryFree id="n26815" type="main" key="li^ti^cen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭtĭcen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lituus-cano</etym>, <sense id="n26815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clarionblower, trumpeter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubicines a tuba et canendo, similiter liticines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=91" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 91</bibl></cit> Müll.: liticines et tubicines, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">notus Hectoris armis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Misenus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:7:19" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
litigans: <entryFree id="n26816" type="main" key="li_ti^gans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lītĭgans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <sense id="n26816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, v. litigo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
litigatio: <entryFree id="n26817" type="main" key="li_ti^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lītĭgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>litigo</etym>, <sense id="n26817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dispute, quarrel</hi> (post-class. for lis, jurgium, certatio): <cit><quote lang="la">omissis litigationibus (al. litigatoribus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> dub. (al. litigatoribus): litigatio <foreign lang="greek">ma/xh h( dia\ lo/gwn</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
litigator: <entryFree id="n26818" type="main" key="li_ti^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lītĭgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one engaged in a dispute, a disputant</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26818.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., Plin. praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">32: litigatores furiosi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> (al. litigationes, v. litigatio).—</sense><sense id="n26818.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a party in a lawsuit, a litigant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litigator rusticus illitteratusque de sua causa melius, quam orator, qui nescit, quid in lite sit, dicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne omnia testimonia expetat a litigatore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:80" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:42" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:105" default="NO">105</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
litigatus: <entryFree id="n26819" type="hapax" key="li_ti^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lītĭgātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lawsuit, process</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc litigatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 6:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 6, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
litiger: <entryFree id="n26820" type="main" key="li_ti^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lītĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lis-gero</etym>, <sense id="n26820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to legal process</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces (consulum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 6, 86</bibl></cit> (295), 19.</sense></entryFree>
litigiosus: <entryFree id="n26821" type="main" key="li_ti^gi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lītĭgĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>litigium</etym>, <sense id="n26821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of disputes, quarrelsome</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26821.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:188" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:26:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 26, 76</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26821.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fond of disputes, contentious, litigious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo minime litigiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:14:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 14, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae anus, quibus nihil litigiosius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines pertinacissimi et litigiosissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 68" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26821.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the object of dispute, <hi rend="ital">disputed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praediolum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:27:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 27, 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26821.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. of the subject of a lawsuit, <hi rend="ital">contested, claimed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de rebus litigiosis et convenire et transigere possumus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundum litigiosum emere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:117" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 18, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lītĭgĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">contentiously</hi>, Aug. c. Duas Epp. Pel. 3, 4, 13.</sense></entryFree>
litigium: <entryFree id="n26822" type="main" key="li_ti^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lītĭgĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>litigo</etym>, <sense id="n26822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dispute, quarrel, strife</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nam ego aliquid contrahere cupio litigii inter eos duos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum viro litigium natum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litigium tibist cum uxore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26822.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">litigation</hi>: litigii seminarium propagare, Vet. Jurec. Consult. 7, 1 Huschke.</sense></entryFree>
litigo: <entryFree id="n26823" type="main" key="li_ti^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lītĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>litem ago</etym>, <sense id="n26823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dispute, quarrel, strive</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26823.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qua de re litigatis inter vos?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hirtium cum Quinctio acerrime litigasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 37, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:35" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 35</bibl>.—Prov.: litigare cum ventis, <hi rend="ital">to give one's self useless trouble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ventis litigo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">miraris, quererisque, litigasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:35:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 35, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26823.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to sue at law, litigate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 25, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 141</bibl>: effectum est ut per concepta verba, id est, per formulas litigaremus, Gai. <cb n="LITT" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 30</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litigatur,</quote> <trans><tr>there is a lawsuit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lītĭgans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a quarrelsome person, a disputant, litigant</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26823.3" n="a" level="4"> In a suit at law, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 6, § 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26823.4" n="b" level="4"> In some other way, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:12:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 12, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lito: <entryFree id="n26824" type="main" key="li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n26824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a., to make an offering which exhibits favorable prognostics, to sacrifice under favorable auspices, to obtain favorable omens</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26824.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26824.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si istuc umquam factum est, tum me Juppiter Faciat, ut semper sacrificem nec umquam litem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec auspicato, nec litato instruunt aciem,</quote> <trans><tr>without favorable omens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Manlium egregie litasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non facile litare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">curt. 7, 7, 29: impia tam saeve gesturus bella litasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 171</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: mola tantum salsa litant, qui non habent tura, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a man can give no more than he has</hi>, Plin. praef. § 11.—</sense><sense id="n26824.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pluribus dis immolatur, qui tandem evenit, ut litetur aliis, aliis non litetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:17:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 17, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litatum est ei deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 28, 40, § 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26824.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximā hostiā litatur saepe pulcherrime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 15, 36</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 183</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanis hostiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26824.5" n="2" level="3"> Of the victim itself, <hi rend="ital">to give a favorable omen, promise a successful event</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">victima Diti patri caesa litavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quacunque manu victima caesa litat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:73:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 73, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26824.6" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to make an offering, offer sacrifice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui hominem immolaverint, exve ejus sanguine litaverint ... capite puniuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 23, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26824.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to offer acceptably</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">exta litabat ovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 24: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra bove,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:630" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 630</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacris litatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacris ex more litatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebe, tibi enim haec sacra litavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:338" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi litavi hoc sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diis sanguinem humanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:4:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:2:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26824.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26824.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring an offering to, to make atonement to, to propitiate, appease, satisfy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litemus Lentulo, parentemus Cethego,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 38, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publico gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:52:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 52, 4</bibl></cit>: aliquid poenā, Auct. B. Hisp. 24. —<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine quaerendi reditus, animāque litandum Argolicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam litatum est Ilio Phoebus redit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agm. 577" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agm. 577</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de alicujus sanguine legibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 132 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n26824.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To devote, consecrate</hi>: plura non habui, dolor, tibi quae litarem, Sen. Med. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem deo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Patient. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victimam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
litoralis: <entryFree id="n26825" type="main" key="li_to^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lītŏrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>3. litus</etym>, <sense id="n26825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the sea-shore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dii litorales,</quote> <trans><tr>that guard the shore, gods of the sea-shore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 30, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Indi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:10:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
litorarius: <entryFree id="n26826" type="main" key="li_to^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lītŏrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the shore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:11:section=134" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 11, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moratio,</quote> <trans><tr>on the shore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 3:5:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
litoreus: <entryFree id="n26827" type="main" key="li_to^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lītŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the sea-shore, shore-, beach-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 725</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cancer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cupra,</quote> <trans><tr>a town of the Piceni, lying on the sea-shore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:434" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 434</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
litorosus: <entryFree id="n26828" type="main" key="li_to^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lītŏrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the shore, on the shore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">callais litoroso mari similis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 151</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: ager litorosissimus, <hi rend="ital">next the shore</hi>, Fab. Maxim. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
littera: <entryFree id="n26829" type="main" key="litte^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">littĕra</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">lītĕra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lino, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n26829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a letter, a written sign</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mark signifying a sound</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26829.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubitum hercle longis litteris signabo jam usquequaque, si quis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hae locuntur litterae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: quid istae narrant? <hi rend="ital">Tox.</hi> Perconctare ex ipsis; <cit><quote lang="la">ipsae tibi narrabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus rostro si humi A litteram impresserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priscarum litterarum notae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 41, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximis litteris incisum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:63:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 63, § 154 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenis appellatio litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 74, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavis appellatio litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si nostris litteris scribantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 28</bibl></cit> litterarum ordine, <hi rend="ital">in alphabetical order</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 54, § 138</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba primis litteris notare, Prob. de Not. Signif. 1 Huschke: digerere in litteram,</quote> <trans><tr>to arrange alphabetically</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 68:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 68, 18</bibl></cit>: scire litteras,<pb n="1072" /> <cb n="LITT" />  <hi rend="ital">to be able to read and write</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescire litteras,</quote> <trans><tr>not to be able to read and write</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:Clem. 2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clem. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere aureis litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:77" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia litterarum,</quote> <trans><tr>the art of writing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:93" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere litteram or litteras,</quote> <trans><tr>to write</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 6</bibl>.—In the language of comedy: <cit><quote lang="la">homo trium litterarum, i. e. fur,</quote> <trans><tr>a thief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 46</bibl></cit>: litteram ex se longam facere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make an I by hanging perpendicularly, to hang one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quicquam meliust mihi, ut opinor, quam ex me ut faciam litteram longam, meum laqueo collum quando obstrinxero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">littera salutaris, i. e. A. (absolvo) and tristis, i. e. C. (condemno), which were put on the voting-tablets,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26829.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26829.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n26829.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A word, a line</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad me litteram numquam misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: ad litteram, <hi rend="ital">word for word, literally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum ad litteram subjeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26829.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A handwriting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexidis manum amabam, quod tam prope accedebat ad similitudinem tuae litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arguit ipsorum quos littera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 138</bibl></cit> (v. also infra B. 1. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n26829.6" n="B" level="2"> Usually <number>plur.</number> </sense><sense id="n26829.7" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Littĕrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a letter, epistle</hi>: litteras resignare, <hi rend="ital">to unseal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">open a letter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut litterarum ego harum sermonem audio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare alicui litteras ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 21, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remittere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullas iis praeterquam ad te et ad Brutum dedi litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">queri apud aliquem per litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 13</bibl></cit>: invitare aliquem perlitteras <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatum animos litteris temptare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 40, 1</bibl></cit>: litterae missae, <hi rend="ital">a letter sent</hi> by a person: litterae allatae, <hi rend="ital">a letter received</hi>: hence, liber litterarum missarum et allatarum, <hi rend="ital">a letter-book</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. M. (i. e. litterae missae) ... L. A. (i. e. litterae allatae), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:71:section=167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 71, § 167</bibl>.—In poets also sometimes in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam legis a rapta Briseide littera venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 515</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:27" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:73 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 73 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n26829.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A writing, document, paper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:63:section=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 63, § 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 16, § 35</bibl>; esp. <hi rend="ital">a written acknowledgment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">littera poscetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 428</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26829.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An account-book</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio omnis et litterae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 11, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12, § 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26829.10" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An edict, ordinance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetoris litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:22:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 22, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras revocavit,</quote> <trans><tr>letter of appointment, commission</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26829.11" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Written monuments, records, literature</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abest historia litteris nostris,</quote> <trans><tr>is wanting in our literature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecae de philosophia litterae,</quote> <trans><tr>philosophical literature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus hoc scriptionis nondum satis Latinis litteris illustratae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:64:228" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 64, 228</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecis litteris studere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 20, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnum Hortensii interitu Latinae litterae fecerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 33, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam artem litteris sine interprete et sine aliqua exercitatione percipi posse,</quote> <trans><tr>merely from books</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod litteris exstet, Pherecydes primum dixit animos hominum esse sempiternos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvae et rarae per eadem tempora litterae fuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etruscae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucissimos adhuc eloquentes litterae Romanae tulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:123" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 123</bibl></cit>: amor litterarum, id. prooem. 6.—</sense><sense id="n26829.12" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">History</hi>, inasmuch as it is derived from written monuments: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidissimus litterarum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cat. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pelop. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvae et rarae per eadem tempora litterae fuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26829.13" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Literary labor, composition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis varietas litterarum mearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nihil temporis tribuit litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26829.14" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An inscription</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 706</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26829.15" n="9" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Learning, the sciences, liberal education, scholarship, letters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit mihi orator tinctus litteris: audierit aliquid, legerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:20:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 20, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant in eo plurimae litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:265" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 76, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo communium litterarum, et politioris humanitatis non expers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo sine ingenio, sine litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit in illo ingenium, ratio, memoria, litterae, cura, cogitatio, diligentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:45:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 45, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi nihil libri, nihil litterae, nihil doctrina prodest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 42, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum coguitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 127</bibl></cit>: nescire litteras, <cb n="LITT" /> <hi rend="ital">to be without a liberal education</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:259" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 74, 259</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">altiores litterae,</quote> <trans><tr>magic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 51</bibl></cit>.—Comically of the art of love: Litteras didicisti; <cit><quote lang="la">quando scis, sine alios discere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
litteralis: <entryFree id="n26830" type="main" key="litte^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">littĕrālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lītĕr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>littera</etym>, <sense id="n26830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to letters</hi> or <hi rend="ital">writing</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">commercium,</quote> <trans><tr>epistolary correspondence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:52" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectio,</quote> <trans><tr>the reading of books</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammatica litteralis dicta, quod a litteris incipiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 414</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
litterarius: <entryFree id="n26831" type="main" key="litte^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">littĕrārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lītĕr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to reading and writing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludus,</quote> <trans><tr>an elementary school</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 45</bibl>: magister. <hi rend="ital">an elementary teacher, schoolmaster</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Pertin. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
litterate: <entryFree id="n26832" type="main" key="litte^ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">littĕrātē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lītĕr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. litteratus <sense id="n26832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
litteratio: <entryFree id="n26833" type="main" key="litte^ra_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">littĕrātio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lītĕr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>littera</etym>, <sense id="n26833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">instruction in reading and writing</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Ordin. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Ordin. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 229</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
litterator: <entryFree id="n26834" type="main" key="litte^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">littĕrātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lītĕr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n26834.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A teacher of reading and writing, an elementary instructor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterator ruditatem eximit, grammaticus doctrinā instruit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 363, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26834.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a grammarian, critic, philologist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 229</bibl>; cf. Kopp ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n26834.2" n="B" level="2"> In opp. to litteratus (a man of real learning), <hi rend="ital">a smatterer, sciolist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter litterator fuit, alter litteras sciens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:9:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 6</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
litteratorius: <entryFree id="n26835" type="main" key="litte^ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">littĕrātōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lītĕr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>litterator</etym>, <sense id="n26835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grammatical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruditio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 10</bibl></cit>.—The <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> not to be used as a substantive: <cit><quote lang="la">grammatice litteratura est, non litteratrix, quemadmodum oratrix: nec litteratoria, quemadmodum oratoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
litteratrix: <entryFree id="n26836" type="main" key="litte^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">littĕrātrix</orth>, v. litteratorius.</entryFree>
litteratulus: <entryFree id="n26837" type="hapax" key="litte^ra_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">littĕrātŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lītĕr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [litteratus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat learned</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Ruf. 1</bibl>, n. 31.</sense></entryFree>
litteratura: <entryFree id="n26838" type="main" key="litte^ra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">littĕrātūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lītĕr-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>litterae</etym>. <sense id="n26838.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A writing</hi> formed of letters: <cit><quote lang="la">litteratura constat ex notis litterarum et ex eo, in quo imprimuntur illae notae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 7, 26</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n26838.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeca,</quote> <trans><tr>the Greek alphabet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26838.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The science of language, grammar, philology</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammatice, quam in Latinum transferentes litteraturam vocaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima illa litteratura, per quam pueris elementa traduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26838.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Learning, erudition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saecularis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
litteratus: <entryFree id="n26839" type="main" key="litte^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">littĕrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lītĕr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>littera</etym>, <sense id="n26839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lettered</hi>, i. e. </sense><sense id="n26839.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">marked with letters, branded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensiculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securicula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laminae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 137, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laciniae auro litteratae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 174, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus,</quote> <trans><tr>a branded slave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homunculi frontes litterati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26839.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26839.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Learned, liberally educated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Canius nec infacetus et satis litteratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et litteratus et disertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 7, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 22, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ineptiis nec litteratior fit quisquam nec melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:13:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of the learned expounders of the poets: <cit><quote lang="la">quem litteratissimum fuisse judico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellatio grammaticorum Graecā consuetudine invaluit: sed initio litterati vocabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26839.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to learning, learned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est enim dulcius otio litterato,</quote> <trans><tr>learned leisure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:265" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 76, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 4, p. 276, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lit-tĕrātē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n26839.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">With plain letters, in a clear hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes perscriptae scite et litterate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26839.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26839.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To the letter, literally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterate respondere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Harusp. Resp. 8, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26839.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Learnedly, scientifically, elegantly, cleverly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptorum veterum litterate peritus,</quote> <trans><tr>learnedly, critically skilled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:56:205" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 56, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belle et litterate dicta,</quote> <trans><tr>clever sayings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:62:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 62, 253</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteratius Latine loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:108:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 108, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
litterio: <entryFree id="n26840" type="main" key="litte^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">littĕrĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lītĕr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>litterae</etym>, <sense id="n26840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a language-master</hi>, in a contemptuous sense: <cit><quote lang="la">appellare (aliquem) loquacem talpam, et purpuratam simiam, et litterionem Graecum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; so, Graecus, Aug. adv. Leg. et Proph. 1, § 52.</sense></entryFree>
litterosus: <entryFree id="n26841" type="hapax" key="litte^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">littĕrōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lītĕr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <cb n="LITU" /> <sense id="n26841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">literary, learned in letters</hi>: homo mere litterosus, Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 133, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
litterula: <entryFree id="n26842" type="main" key="litte^ru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">littĕrŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lītĕr-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>littera</etym>. <sense id="n26842.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little letter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accepi tuam epistolam vacillantibus litterulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26842.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: litterulae, ārum. </sense><sense id="n26842.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A short letter, a note</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc litterularum exaravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26842.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Grammatical knowledge, literary learning, liberal studies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem propter litterularum nescio quid libenter vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterulae meae oblanguerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 21, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterulis Graecis imbutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
littus: <entryFree id="n26843" type="main" key="littus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">littus</orth>, v. litus.</entryFree>
litubium: <entryFree id="n26844" type="main" key="Litubi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Litubĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n26844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Liguria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
litura: <entryFree id="n26845" type="main" key="li^tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭtūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lino</etym>, <sense id="n26845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smearing, anointing</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26845.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">solem etiam et pluviam arcet ejusmodi litura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26845.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26845.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rubbing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">smearing of the wax on a writing-tablet, in order to erase something written;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a blotting out, erasure, correction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius nominis litura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26845.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26845.5" n="1" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a passage erased, an erasure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtis extremam partem nominis demersam esse in litura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae lituraeque omnes assimilatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 77</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">189: carmen multā liturā coërcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 292</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26845.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A blot, blur</hi> made in a writing: <cit><quote lang="la">haec erit e lacrimis facta litura meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">littera suffusas quod habet maculosa lituras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26845.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A wrinkle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum corpus nulla litura notet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:18:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26845.8" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an alteration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ulla in decretis ejus litura sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
liturarius: <entryFree id="n26846" type="main" key="li^tu_ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭtūrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>litura</etym>, <sense id="n26846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for rubbing out</hi>.—Only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: * <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭtū-rārii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. libri), <hi rend="ital">books kept for the first rough drafts of writings, blotters</hi> (so called from the erasures made in them), Aus. praef. Idyll. 13.</sense></entryFree>
liturgus: <entryFree id="n26847" type="greek" key="li_turgus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līturgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leitourgo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who fills a public office, a servant of the state</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 24, 6.—</sense><sense id="n26847.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an attendant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lituro: <entryFree id="n26848" type="main" key="li^tu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭtūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>litura</etym>, <sense id="n26848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blot out, erase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liturasse aliqua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4405</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
litus: <entryFree id="n26849" type="main" key="li^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from lino.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26850" type="main" key="li^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lino</etym>, <sense id="n26850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smearing, besmearing, anointing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 110</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 20</bibl>, instead of litum we should read lenitum; v. Targa, ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26851" type="main" key="li_tus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lītus</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">littus</orth>), <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">li/mnh, leimw/n, limh/n</foreign>; and lino</etym>, <sense id="n26851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sea-shore, seaside, beach, strand</hi> (opp. ripa, <hi rend="ital">the bank</hi> of a river: ora, <hi rend="ital">the coast</hi> of the sea; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 37</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 75</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">litus est, quousque maximus fluctus a mari pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:96" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solebat Aquilius quaerentibus, quid esset litus, ita definire: qua fluctus eluderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:7:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est tam commune quam ... litus ejectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus tunditur undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetervolare litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:40" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Circaeae raduntur litora terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:844" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 844</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinuosum legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:451" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litoris ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 396</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 44</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">litus arare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to labor in vain, take useless pains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:4:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 4, 48</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">litus sterili versamus aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:49" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 49</bibl></cit>: in litus harenas fundere, <hi rend="ital">to pour sand on the sea-shore</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to add to that of which there is already an abundance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26851.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26851.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A landing-place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod uno parvoque litore adiretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26851.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The shore of a lake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trasimeni litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:818" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 818</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Larium litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 35, 4</bibl></cit>;
