<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26851.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The bank of a river</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostias constituit omnes in litore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:31:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 31, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridique in litore conspicitur sus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percussa fluctu litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 5, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26851.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Land situated on the sea-side</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui litus arandum dedimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">electione litorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lituus: <entryFree id="n26852" type="main" key="li^tu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭtŭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n26852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> lituum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 237</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:166" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:146" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 146</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prob. Etruscan; prim. signif. crooked</etym>. </sense><sense id="n26852.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26852.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The crooked staff borne by the augurs, an augur's crook</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crosier, augural wand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra manu baculum sine nodo aduncum tenens, quem lituum appellaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lituus iste vester, quod clarissimum est insigne auguratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1073" /> <cb n="LIVI" /> 30; <cit><quote lang="la">Geh. 5, 7, 8: Quirinalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lituo pulcher trabeaque Quirinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:375" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 375</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26852.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A crooked wind-instrument</hi> (used to give signals in war), <hi rend="ital">a curved trumpet, cornet, clarion</hi>: lituus sonitus effudit acutos, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=116" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 116</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 522 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 167</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam lituus pugnae signa daturus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:216" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lituo tubae Permixtus sonitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridor lituum clangorque tubarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua cum lituis audita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:200" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26852.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a signal</hi>: de lituis, <foreign lang="greek">bow/pidos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 12, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26852.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an instigator, author</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lituus meae profectionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
livedo: <entryFree id="n26853" type="hapax" key="li_ve_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līvēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>liveo</etym>, <sense id="n26853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blueness, lividness</hi>, produced by bruises, blows, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">homunculi vibicibus livedinis totam cutem depicti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
livens: <entryFree id="n26854" type="main" key="li_vens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līvens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from liveo.</entryFree>
liventer: <entryFree id="n26855" type="main" key="li_venter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līventer</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>liveo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, A. <sense id="n26855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
liveo: <entryFree id="n26856" type="main" key="li_ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līvĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>for pliveo; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pelio/s, pello/s</foreign>, dark-blue; cf.: pullus, pallidus</etym>, <sense id="n26856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be of a bluish color, black and blue, livid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">livent rubigine dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 776</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">livere catenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 65.—</sense><sense id="n26856.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be envious, to envy</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for invideo). </sense><sense id="n26856.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">livet Carinus, rumpitur, furit, plorat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:61:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 61, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:211" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 211</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26856.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat., to envy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">livere iis, qui eloquentiam exercent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mihi livet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:86:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 86, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:94:1" default="NO">11, 94, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lī-vens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n26856.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Bluish, lead-colored, black and blue, livid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:817" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 817</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura compedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi in morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:617" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 617</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:707" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 707</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26856.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Envious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid imprecabor, o Severe, liventi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:61:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 61, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">līventer</orth>, <hi rend="ital">lividly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Petr.</author> 4, 192</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
livesco: <entryFree id="n26857" type="main" key="li_vesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līvesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n26857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to turn black and blue, become livid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">digiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 528</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 181" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 181</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n26857.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to envy, be envious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim livescere fas est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
livia: <entryFree id="n26858" type="main" key="Li_vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Līvĭa</orth>, v. Livius.</entryFree>
livianus: <entryFree id="n26859" type="main" key="Li_vi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Līvĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Livius, B.</entryFree>
livide: <entryFree id="n26860" type="main" key="li_vi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līvĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. lividus <sense id="n26860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lividinans: <entryFree id="n26861" type="hapax" key="li_vi^dinans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līvĭdinans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lividus</etym>, <sense id="n26861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">envious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse Paris dearum lividinantium judex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 138</bibl></cit> dub. (al. libidinantium; al. litigantium).</sense></entryFree>
livido: <entryFree id="n26862" type="main" key="li_vi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līvĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to render livid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallore vultum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 619</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lividulus: <entryFree id="n26863" type="hapax" key="li_vi^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līvĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">somewhat envious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus invideas si lividulus sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:110" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lividus: <entryFree id="n26864" type="main" key="li_vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>liveo</etym>, <sense id="n26864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a blue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leaden color, bluish, blue</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26864.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lividissima vorago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">racemi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26864.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., produced by beating, bruising, etc., <hi rend="ital">black and blue, livid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">livida armis Bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora livida facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 55, § 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26864.3" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">making livid</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">deadly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">livida materno fervent adipata veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:631" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 631</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26864.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">envious, invidious, spiteful, malicious</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26864.5" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">invidi et malevoli et lividi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 12, 28</bibl></cit> (dub.): <cit><quote lang="la">nos nostraque lividus odit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26864.6" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:74" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obliviones (because forgetfulness robs the deserving of the praise which is his due),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <trans><tr>spiteful, malicious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">līvĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., of a leaden color, lividly.—Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 94</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
livilla: <entryFree id="n26865" type="main" key="Li_villa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Līvilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>Livia</etym>, <sense id="n26865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of Germanicus and Agrippina, and sister of Caligula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
livius: <entryFree id="n26866" type="main" key="Li_vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Līvĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>), <sense id="n26866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens.—So, M. Livius Andronicus, <hi rend="ital">the first Roman tragic poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Livius,</quote> <trans><tr>the celebrated historian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:32 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 32 al.</bibl></cit>: C. Livius Salinator, <hi rend="ital">consul with</hi> L. Valerius Messala, A. U. C. 584; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 37, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 273</bibl>; and many others.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Līvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae, Drusilla</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the second wife of Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:157" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Livia Orestilla,</quote> <trans><tr>wife of Caligula</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26866.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Līvĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Livian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liviae leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:413" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 413</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26866.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Līvĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Livian</hi>: <cb n="LOCA" /> modi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of Livius Andronicus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 39</bibl>: exercitus, <hi rend="ital">the army of the consul</hi> M. Livius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes,</quote> <trans><tr>from mines belonging to Livia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">charta,</quote> <trans><tr>named after Livia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 80</bibl></cit>; cf. § 74.</sense></entryFree>
livor: <entryFree id="n26867" type="main" key="li_vor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līvor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>liveo</etym>, <sense id="n26867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bluish color, leaden color, a black and blue spot</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26867.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam livorem tute scapulis istoc concinnas tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">livore decoloratum corpus mortui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostendere nigram in facie tumidis livoribus offam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11" default="NO">11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:46" default="NO">5, 10, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illinitur livoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 87, § 240</bibl></cit>.—Of a <hi rend="ital">speck</hi> or <hi rend="ital">taint</hi> in fruit: <cit><quote lang="la">uva conspectā livorem ducit ab uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:81" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum sucos herbasque dedi queis livor abiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26867.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">envy, spite, malice, ill-will</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug. for invidia): summā malevolentiā et livore impediuntur, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtrectatio et livor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: pascitur in vivis livor; <cit><quote lang="la">post fata quiescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo submotum patriā proscindere, livor, Desine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpere, livor edax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">livor ac malignitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:3:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:58:5" default="NO" valid="yes">58, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lix: <entryFree id="n26868" type="gloss" key="lix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lix</orth>, <itype>līcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ashes, lye</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lix est cinis vel umor cineri admixtus: nam etiamnum id genus lixivium vocatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 62, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lixa: <entryFree id="n26869" type="main" key="lixa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lixa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. linquo</etym>, <sense id="n26869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sutler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non lixa sequebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lixae modo sine insignibus, sine lictoribus, profectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lixarum in modum negotiari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lixae ac negotiatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26869.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26869.2" n="A" level="2"> In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lixae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">camp-followers</hi>, consisting of sutlers, cooks, servants, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">lixas e castris submovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lixae permixti cum militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne lixae exercitum sequerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmini totidem lixas habenti quot milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 42</bibl></cit>; Justin. 38, 10, 2.—</sense><sense id="n26869.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An attendant on a magistrate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lixabundus: <entryFree id="n26870" type="main" key="lixa_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lixābundus</orth> <etym>lixa</etym>, <sense id="n26870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">journeying at pleasure</hi>: iter libere ac prolixe faciens, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=116" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 116</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lixabundus ambulat, qui voluptatis causā ambulat, Gloss. Isid.: Pinacium tam lixabundum currere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit> Fleck.; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
lixio: <entryFree id="n26871" type="gloss" key="lixio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lixio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sutler, camp-follower</hi>: lixiones aquarum portitores, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
lixivius: <entryFree id="n26872" type="main" key="lixi_vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lixīvĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lix</etym>, <sense id="n26872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made into lye</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinere lixivio abluere,</quote> <trans><tr>lye-ashes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 18, 75, § 244</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26872.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lixīvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">lye</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lixivia cineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50" default="NO">12, 50</bibl>. —Also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lixīvĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">lye</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa prunorum lixivio sunt maceranda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua cineribus distillata, quam volgo lixivium vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:3:70" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 3, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lixivus: <entryFree id="n26873" type="main" key="lixi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lixīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made into lye</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinis lixiva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Larg. 216" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Larg. 216</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:230" default="NO">230</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 27, 69, § 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:67" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 17, 18, § 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustum lixivum,</quote> <trans><tr>the must which flows from the grapes before they are pressed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26873.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lixīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">lye</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 2, 15, 18</bibl>; and so perh. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lixo: <entryFree id="n26874" type="gloss" key="lixo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lixo</orth> <foreign lang="greek">e(/yw</foreign>, <sense id="n26874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to boil, seethe</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lixulae: <entryFree id="n26875" type="gloss" key="lixu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lixŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>a Sabine word</etym>, <sense id="n26875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a round pancake made of flour, cheese, and water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 107</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
lixus: <entryFree id="n26876" type="main" key="Lixus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lixus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*li/cos</foreign>, <sense id="n26876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Mauritania, with a city of the same name</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Wady al-Khos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:10:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:258" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 258</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:400" default="NO">5, 400</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
loba: <entryFree id="n26877" type="main" key="lo^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n26877.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The haulm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">straw of Indian millet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 7, 10, § 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26877.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Nightshade, also called</hi> strychnos, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
localis: <entryFree id="n26878" type="main" key="lo^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>locus</etym>, <sense id="n26878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a place, local</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">determinatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locale universali opponit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Scapul. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerumnae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adverbia,</quote> <trans><tr>adverbs of place</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 182</bibl></cit> P.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">locally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Besae dei localiter appellati oraculum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by the inhabitants</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
localitas: <entryFree id="n26879" type="main" key="lo^ca_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">locality</hi>, as a necessary quality of bodies, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
localiter: <entryFree id="n26880" type="main" key="lo^ca_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. localis <sense id="n26880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
locarius: <entryFree id="n26881" type="main" key="lo^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>loco</etym>, <sense id="n26881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to letting;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">substt</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26881.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcārĭus</orth>,<cb n="LOCO" />  <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who first took possession of a seat in the theatre and let it out to one who came later</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hermes, divitiae locariorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a famous gladiator, who filled the theatre, and thus brought much gain to those who parted with their seats for hire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:24:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 24, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26881.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">rent paid for a stall</hi> to sell goods from, <hi rend="ital">stall-money, stallage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 15</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
locatarius: <entryFree id="n26882" type="gloss" key="lo^ca_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcātārĭus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">o( misqou/menos</foreign>, <sense id="n26882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contractor</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
locaticius: <entryFree id="n26883" type="main" key="lo^ca_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcātīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>loco</etym>, <sense id="n26883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">let, hired out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatigatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Ep. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
locatio: <entryFree id="n26884" type="main" key="lo^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a placing, locating; a disposition, arrangement</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26884.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">recta locatio, prioribus sequentia annectens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit> dub. (Zumpt, collocatio): <cit><quote lang="la">locatio verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26884.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a letting out, leasing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (porticus) consulum locatione reficiebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locationes praediorum rusticorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the farming out of the Macedonian crown-lands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26884.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a contract of letting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hiring, a lease</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consensu fiunt obligationes in locationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:135" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:142" default="NO">142</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
locatitius: <entryFree id="n26885" type="main" key="lo^ca_ti_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcātītĭus</orth>, v. locaticius.</entryFree>
locator: <entryFree id="n26886" type="main" key="lo^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>loco</etym>, <sense id="n26886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who lets, a letter, hirer out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:60" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae et fundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretricum, Firm. Math. 4, 6: LOCATOR A SCENA or SCENICORVM,</quote> <trans><tr>one who furnished for a stipulated sum the actors and stage apparatus to him who gave a play</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2618 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2629</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26886.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A contractor, undertaker</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">funeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 52, 53, § 176</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
locatorius: <entryFree id="n26887" type="hapax" key="lo^ca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to letting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hiring out</hi>: locatorius, <foreign lang="greek">misqwsimai=os</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">locatoria provincia,</quote> <trans><tr>where one will be a mere letter out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
locellus: <entryFree id="n26888" type="main" key="lo^cellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>locus</etym>, <sense id="n26888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little place;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n26888.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A compartment in a locker</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chest</hi>, Caes. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 60</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:88" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26888.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A chest, casket</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulos in locellum repositos haeredibus reddidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:8:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 8, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lochia: <entryFree id="n26889" type="greek" key="Lochi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lochīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">loxei/a</foreign> (midwife), <sense id="n26889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Diana</hi>, Inscr. ap. Grut. 1011, 3.</sense></entryFree>
locito: <entryFree id="n26890" type="main" key="lo^ci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>loco</etym>, <sense id="n26890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to let</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hire out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agelli hic est sub urbe paulum, quod locitas foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
loco: <entryFree id="n26891" type="main" key="lo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (old forms, locassim for locaverim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 51</bibl>; so, <sense id="n26891.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">locassint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>locus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to place, put, lay, set, dispose, arrange</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26891.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26891.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">equites pro cornibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crates adversas locari jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites super vallum in munimentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sol ita locatus fuisset, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 15, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundamenta (urbis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 266</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 428</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramineoque viros locat ipse sedili,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendium et commeatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26891.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26891.4" n="1" level="3"> Locare puellam in matrimonium or in matrimonio, nuptiis, nuptum, or simply locare, <hi rend="ital">to give a girl in marriage, to marry her</hi> to any one: cur me huic locabas nuptiis? Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 24, 38</bibl> (Trag. v. 157 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">virginem habeo grandem, neque eam queo locare quoiquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in matrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam in luculentam familiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptum virginem adulescenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26891.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To let, lease, to hire</hi> or <hi rend="ital">farm out</hi> (opp. conduco): <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum frumento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia non nummo sed partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernas civitatibus ad stationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26891.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To give out on contract, to contract for having a thing done</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu idem optimum est Loces efferendum: nam jam credo mortuus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impero, ut tu me quoivis castrandum loces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quod sit sibi operis locatum ecficeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego operam meam tribus nummis hodie locavi ad artis naugatorias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuam faciendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:43:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 43, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majore pecuniā columnas dealbandas, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 59</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">154: statuas demoliendas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>, § 161: auseribus cibaria publice locantur (sc. praebenda),<pb n="1074" /> <cb n="LOCU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junoni templum (sc. exstruendum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta exercitui (sc. facienda),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentesque locat Caesonia Rhenos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:47" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26891.7" n="c" level="4"> Locare se or locare operam suam, <hi rend="ital">to hire one's self out, hire out one's services</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si aliquo ad ludos me pro manduco locem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam suam ad aliquam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to become a ranter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:185" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locare noctes, of courtesans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26891.8" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To lend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta quae locavi metuo ut possim recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26891.9" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To quarter, establish in quarters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes novis hibernaculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 38</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26891.10" n="3" level="3"> Of money, <hi rend="ital">to invest, place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam argenti locavi jam diu usquam aeque bene?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 144</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26891.11" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lend out</hi> money on interest: <cit><quote lang="la">locare argenti nemini nummum queo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>. —Hence, locare se, <hi rend="ital">to bring in</hi> interest, <hi rend="ital">to yield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina (histrionis) quae erat (Panurgo) ab hoc (Roscio) tradita, locabat se non minus HS CCCICCC,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26891.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26891.13" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to place, put, set, lay, fix</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuo hercle ne illa mulier mi insidias locet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num tu pudicae quoipiam insidias locas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam in tam clara luce locavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter recte factum atque peccatum media locabat quaedam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 10, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in amplissimo gradu dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas in Catonis et Bruti fide locata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia mea studia in Milonis magistratu fixi et locavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo loco locati sumus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos hortor, ut ita virtutem locetis, ut eā exceptā nihil amicitiā praestabilius esse putetis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res certis in personis ac temporibus locata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentia est locata in delectu bonorum et malorum,</quote> <trans><tr>consists in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 17, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium apud gratos,</quote> <trans><tr>to confer upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 20</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26891.14" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. 2. c.) <hi rend="ital">To put out</hi>, as at interest; <hi rend="ital">to place so as to secure a return</hi>: optumo optume optumam operam das; <cit><quote lang="la">datam pulcre locas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia apud gratos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: benefacta male locata male facta arbitror, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 62</bibl> (Trag. v. 429 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n26891.15" n="C" level="2"> Locare nomen, <hi rend="ital">to become surety</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is placed on lease, hired out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
locri: <entryFree id="n26892" type="main" key="Lo_^cri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lō^cri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lokroi/</foreign>. <sense id="n26892.0" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A people of Greece, consisting of several tribes</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26892.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The</hi> Locri Epicnemidii, <hi rend="ital">on the Cephissus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26892.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The</hi> Locri Ozolae, <hi rend="ital">bordering on the Ætolians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 7</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n26892.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The</hi> Locri Epizephyrii, <hi rend="ital">in the territory of the Bruttii, where they had founded the city of Narycium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:29:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 29, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26892.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The city of Narycium, a colony of the Grecian Locrians</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Gierace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud procul ab urbe Locris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 96, 98, § 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:152" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 47, 48, § 152</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. p. 186.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26892.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŏcrensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Epizephyrian Locrians, Locrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 27, 32, § 95</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŏcrenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Locrians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 90</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n26892.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lō^cris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lokri/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the country of Locris, in Greece</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
loculamentum: <entryFree id="n26893" type="main" key="lo^cu^la_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcŭlāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>loculus</etym>, <sense id="n26893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a case, box, receptacle</hi> for any thing. </sense><sense id="n26893.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., for doves: <cit><quote lang="la">loculamenta, quibus nidificent aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:9:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for books: tecto tenus exstructa loculamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 9:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26893.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a case, box, cell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the gums</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
locularis: <entryFree id="n26894" type="main" key="lo^cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">kept in boxes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">resina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 25, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
loculatus: <entryFree id="n26895" type="hapax" key="lo^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with compartments</hi> or <hi rend="ital">divisions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loculatae arculae, piscinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
loculosus: <entryFree id="n26896" type="main" key="lo^cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of little compartments</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cells</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">putamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 88</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
loculus: <entryFree id="n26897" type="main" key="lo^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>locus</etym>, <sense id="n26897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little place</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26897.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in cella est paulum nimis loculi lubrici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26897.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26897.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A coffin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites in loculis asservati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 16, § 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 7, 14</bibl>: hunc (pollicem regis in dextro pede) <cb n="LOCU" /> cremari cum reliquo corpore non potuisse tradunt, conditumque loculo in templo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26897.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bier</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Planc. Exposit. Serm. p. 558</bibl> Merc.—</sense><sense id="n26897.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A compartment, manger, stall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loculi vel marmore vel lapide vel ligno facti distinguendi sunt, ut singula jumenta hordeum suum ex integro nullo praeripiente consumant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 56, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26897.6" n="D" level="2"> In <number>plur.</number>: loculi, <hi rend="ital">a small receptacle with compartments, a coffer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">casket</hi> for keeping all sorts of things in: <cit><quote lang="la">gestit enim nummum in loculos demittere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 175</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramina continuo loculis depromit eburnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:749" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 749</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos de flavā loculos implere monetā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (loculis) erant claves vinariae cellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 13, 14, § 89</bibl></cit>.— Hence, stimulorum loculi, applied to a bad slave, qs. <hi rend="ital">you receptacle for goads</hi> (with which slaves were chastised), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 11</bibl>; v. stimulus.—</sense><sense id="n26897.7" n="E" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a purse, pocket</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e peculiaribus loculis suis,</quote> <trans><tr>out of his own pocket</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevo suspensi loculos tabulamque lacerto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim loculis comitantibus itur ad casum tabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:89" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:46 al" default="NO">10, 46 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
locuples: <entryFree id="n26898" type="main" key="lo^cu_^ples"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcū^ples</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype> (ū, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:36:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 36, 6</bibl>; <sense id="n26898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> locupletium and locupletum; <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> locuplete, usu. of a person, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 46</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely of a thing,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:74" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locupleti, of things,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 9, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely of a person,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 46</bibl></cit>; Macrob. S. 5, 18, 14; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 49 sq.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>locus-plenus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">rich in lands, substantial, opulent</hi> (syn.: dives, abundans, copiosus). </sense><sense id="n26898.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tum erat res in pecore et locorum possessionibus: ex quo pecuniosi et locupletes vocabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 9, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(P. Nigidius) locupletem dictum ait ex compositis vocibus, qui pleraque loca, hoc est, qui multas possessiones teneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 5</bibl></cit>: locupletes locorum multorum domini, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=119" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 119</bibl> Müll.— <cit><quote lang="la">So too, locupletem a locorum copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locupletes dicebant loci, hoc est agri plenos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum genus est eorum, qui magno in aere alieno, majores etiam possessiones habent: horum hominum species est honestissima, sunt enim locupletes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely of things: neque minus locuples ad eos hereditas perveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:192" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 192</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26898.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">rich, wealthy, opulent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ornatu ut locupletes simus scitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egebat? immo locuples erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier copiosa plane et locuples,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:17:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17, 55</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycurgus agros locupletium plebi, ut servitio, colendos dedit,</quote> <trans><tr>the rich</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut suffragia non in multitudinis, sed in locupletium potestate essent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 39</bibl></cit>.—So <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locuples quae nupsit avaro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locuples et referta domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:de Or. 1:35:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locuplete penu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:74" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locupletem optare podagram,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>characteristic of the rich</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:96" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 96</bibl></cit>. —With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedā locuples,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locuples frugibus annus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipiis locuples,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 39</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 202, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locuples aquila,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the lucrative post of centurion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:197" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 197</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case> in thesauris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:51:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 51, 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locupletior negotiator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs locupletissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locupletissimae urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26898.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26898.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Well stored</hi> or <hi rend="ital">provided, richly supplied, rich</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lyslas oratione locuples, rebus ipsis jejunior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 40, 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinam linguam non modo non inopem, sed locupletiorem etiam esse quam Graecam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26898.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that is able to answer for a thing, that is a good surety, responsible, trustworthy, reliable, safe, sure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus,</quote> <trans><tr>that can fulfil his engagement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>: auctor, testis, <hi rend="ital">a sufficient surety, a credible witness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythagoras et Plato locupletissimi auctores, jubent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 58, 119</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem enim auctorem de illo (Socrate) locupletiorem Platone laudare possumus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locuples auctor Thucydides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 12, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:19:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 19, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedit etiam testis locuples, Posidonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellarius,</quote> <trans><tr>a trusty, safe letter-carrier</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcū^plētē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">richly, amply</hi> (postclass.).<cb n="LOCU" />  </sense><sense id="n26898.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locupletissime mu neratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dotata filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 9" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26898.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad Anton. Imp. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad Anton. Imp. 1, 3</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
locupletatio: <entryFree id="n26899" type="main" key="lo^cu_^ple_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcū^plētātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>locupleto</etym>, <sense id="n26899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enriching, a rich possession</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
locupletator: <entryFree id="n26900" type="main" key="lo^cu_^ple_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcū^plētātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enricher</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">familiarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">MVNICIPII,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 816</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
locuplete: <entryFree id="n26901" type="main" key="lo^cu_^ple_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcū^plētē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. locuples <sense id="n26901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
locupleto: <entryFree id="n26902" type="main" key="lo^cu_^ple_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcū^plēto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>locuples</etym>, <sense id="n26902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make rich, enrich</hi> (syn. dito). </sense><sense id="n26902.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: auro suas domus, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:34" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines fortunis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima auri argentique praeda locupletatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:24:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 24, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:31:section=80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 31, § 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africam equis, armis, viris, pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hamilc. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hamilc. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeriter locupletari,</quote> <trans><tr>to grow rich</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § 4.— </sense><sense id="n26902.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to enrich</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientem locupletat ipsa natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsam eloquentiam graviorum artium instrumento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:331" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 97, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum picturis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to decorate, adorn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
locus: <entryFree id="n26903" type="main" key="lo^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcus</orth> (old form stlocus, like stlis for lis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 16</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Inscr. ap. Grut. 129, 14; <number>plur.</number> loci, single places; loca, places connected with each other, a region; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 666 sq., and <sense id="n26903.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <hi rend="ital">a place, spot</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26903.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26903.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">adsedistis in festivo loco,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the theatre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum sibi velle liberum praeberier, ubi nequam faciat clam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 44</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">3, 2, 25: omnes copias in unum locum convenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli qui ea loca incolerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum situm naturam regionis nosse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae per omnes locos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere alicui locum in turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex loco superiore agere, of an orator speaking from the rostra, or of a judge pronouncing judgment: de loco superiore dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:42:section=102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 42, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aequo loco, of one speaking in the Senate or conversing with another: et ex superiore et ex aequo loco sermones habiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex inferiore loco,</quote> <trans><tr>to speak before a judge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: primus locus aedium, <hi rend="ital">a dwelling on the ground-floor</hi>, Nep. praef. 6.—<hi rend="ital">A post, position</hi>: loco movere, <hi rend="ital">to drive from a place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">post</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 32</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">loco deicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loco cedere,</quote> <trans><tr>to give way, abandon one's post, retire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26903.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26903.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A place, seat</hi>, in the theatre, the circus, or the forum: <cit><quote lang="la">Servi ne obsideant, liberis ut sit locus,</quote> <trans><tr>room, seats</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 23</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp. the place assigned by the Senate to foreign ambassadors: locum ad spectandum dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">34, 72</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 17</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> loca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 44, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:32:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 32, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 21</bibl>.—But <number>plur.</number> loci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26903.5" n="2" level="3"> So of the <hi rend="ital">lodging, quarters, place of abode</hi> assigned to foreign ambassadors for their residence: <cit><quote lang="la">locus inde lautiaque legatis praeberi jussa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 39, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 17, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 26, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:56" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca lautia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 140, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26903.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A piece</hi> or <hi rend="ital">part</hi> of an estate: <cit><quote lang="la">stricte loquendo locus non est fundus sed pars aliqua fundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:60" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus certus ex fundo possideri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:26" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 41, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26903.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A place, spot, locality;
