a country region</hi>: hau longe abesse oportet homines hinc; <cit><quote lang="la">ita hic lepidust locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc hoc ubi abstrudam cogito solum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hoc ut oppido praeposui, sed ut loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 530</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 12</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> <hi rend="ital">of the inhabitants of a place, a neighborhood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numina vicinorum odit uterque locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:37" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 37</bibl></cit>.—Of a place where a city once stood, <hi rend="ital">a site</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus Pherae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 6, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus Buprasium, Hyrmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:280" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 280</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> rarely loci: <cit><quote lang="la">quos locos adiisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locos tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:76:1" default="NO" valid="yes">76, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 509</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 306</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 8, 22; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 43</bibl>.—Usually loca: <cit><quote lang="la">loca haec circiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venisse in illa loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:2 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 373</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:3" default="NO" valid="yes">63, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes">54, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 495</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:97" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 6, 4</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n26903.8" n="5" level="3"> In war <pb n="1075" /> <cb n="LOCU" /> or battle, <hi rend="ital">a post, station</hi> (<number>plur.</number> loca): <cit><quote lang="la">tum loca sorte legunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca jussa tenere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca servare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26903.9" n="6" level="3"> Loci and loca, of <hi rend="ital">parts of the body</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci nervosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 26</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:2:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; and without <pos>adj.</pos>, in females, <hi rend="ital">the womb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ea lotio locos fovebit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in locis semen insederit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl>. —Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 10</bibl>.—Of birds, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:14:1246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 14, 1246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 84, § 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:8" default="NO">8, 11, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in males,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1034" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1034</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1045" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1045</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26903.10" n="7" level="3"> Communis locus, </sense><sense id="n26903.11" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The place of the dead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nunc abierunt hinc in communem locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26903.12" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A public place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sthenius ... qui oppidum non maximum maximis ex pecunia sua locis communibus monumentisque decoravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:46:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 46, § 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26903.13" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A burial-place, grave;</hi> very freq. in epitaphs; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4499</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4500</bibl> sq.</sense><sense id="n26903.14" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26903.15" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A topic</hi> of discussion or thought; <hi rend="ital">a matter, subject, point, head</hi> or <hi rend="ital">division</hi> of a subject. </sense><sense id="n26903.16" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fundamentum esset philosophiae positum in finibus bonorum, perpurgatus est is locus a nobis quinque libris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theophrastus cum tractat locos ab Aristotele ante tractatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic locus, de natura usuque verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:162" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 48, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiae noti et tractati loci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 33, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quattuor locis in quos honesti naturam vimque divisimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 26</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:6" default="NO">2, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:4" default="NO">5, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:245" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 245</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26903.17" n="2" level="3"> Esp.: loci, <hi rend="ital">the grounds of proof, the points</hi> on which proofs are founded or from which they are deduced: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pervestigare argumentum aliquod volumus, locos nosse debemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 13, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 55, 210</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">traditi sunt ex quibus argumenta ducantur duplices loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 35</bibl></cit>; so <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque licet definire, locum esse argumenti sedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26903.18" n="3" level="3"> Esp.: loci communes, <hi rend="ital">general arguments</hi>, which do not grow out of the particular facts of a case, but are applicable to any class of cases: <cit><quote lang="la">pars (argumentorum) est pervagatior et aut in omnis ejusdem generis aut in plerasque causas adcommodata: haec ergo argumenta, quae transferri in multas causas possunt, locos communis nominamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:14:47 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 14, 47 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. the passage at length; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 50</bibl> sq.; 2, 18, 56; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:12" default="NO">3, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:1:3" default="NO">5, 1, 3</bibl>; 5, 13, 57 al.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix ullus est tam communis locus, qui possit cohaerere cum causa, nisi aliquo proprio quaestionis vinculo copulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus, for communis locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:32" default="NO">5, 7, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26903.19" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A passage</hi> in a book or author; <number>plur.</number> loci (Zumpt, Gram. § <cit><quote lang="la">99): locos quosdam transferam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:4" default="NO">1, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:42" default="NO">5, 13, 42</bibl>; 6, 3, 36; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locos Lucreti plurimos sectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:21:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 21, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but rarely loca: loca jam recitata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 223</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n26903.20" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Room, opportunity, cause, occasion, place, time</hi>, etc., for any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">et cognoscendi et ignoscendi dabitur peccati locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia paululum aliquid loci rationi et consilio dedisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tuo in me animo iniquis secus existimandi videris nonnihil dedisse loci,</quote> <trans><tr>to have given occasion, cause, reason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare suspicioni locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare locum dubitationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:451" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 451</bibl>: locum habere, <hi rend="ital">to find a place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui dolorem summum malum dicit, apud eum, quem locum habet fortitudo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc altero dicacitatis quid habet ars loci?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 219</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">locus est alicui rei: legi Aquiliae locus est adversus te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huic edicto locus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:10:6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 37, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">meritis vacat hic tibi locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum defendendi negandive non est locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 21</bibl></cit>.—Also in the sense of <hi rend="ital">there is place for any thing, it finds acceptance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in poëtis non Homero soli locus est aut Archilocho, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in mea familiaritate locus esset nemini nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 33, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledicto nihil loci est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: locum non relinquere, <hi rend="ital">to leave no room for, not to admit, to exclude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita turpis ne morti quidem honestae locum relinquit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 49</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nec precibus nostris nec admonitionibus relinquit locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: nancisci locum, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="LOCU" /> <hi rend="ital">find occasion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nactus locum resecandae libidinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde gaudeo, si est nunc ullus gaudendi locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26903.21" n="D" level="2"> In aliquo loco esse, <hi rend="ital">to be in any place, position, situation, condition, state, relation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ego in istoc siem loco, dem potius aurum, quam, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>position, place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta ibi copia venustatum aderat, in suo quaeque loco sita munde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in uxoris loco habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in liberūm loco esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:49:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 49, 200</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1, 1</bibl>; but more freq. without <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is si eo loco esset, negavit se facturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem loco esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:8:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:7:14:6" default="NO">7, 14, 6</bibl>.—Esp. with a <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentis loco esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:19:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 19, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium loco esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratris loco esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero hic locus est, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>not the proper occasion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 12, 33</bibl>.— Hence, loco or in loco, <hi rend="ital">at the right place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">time, seasonably, suitably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">posuisti loco versus Attianos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolae non in loco redditae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulce est desipere in loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">locis: non insurgit locis? non figuris gaudet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo res summa loco?</quote> <trans><tr>in what condition?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo sit fortuna loco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 723</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo sit Romana loco res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo tua sit fortuna loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:558" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 558</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missis nuntiis, quo loco res essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 47, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo loco,</quote> <trans><tr>in the first place, first in order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:12" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—Freq. as a <hi rend="ital">partit. gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo loci for quo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo loci for eo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:31:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 31, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibidem loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 3, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interea loci for interea,</quote> <trans><tr>meanwhile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea loci,</quote> <trans><tr>after that, afterwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque locorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc locorum,</quote> <trans><tr>hitherto</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad id locorum,</quote> <trans><tr>to that time, till then, hitherto</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 63:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 63, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:73:2" default="NO" valid="yes">73, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 38, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post id locorum,</quote> <trans><tr>after that, thereupon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde loci,</quote> <trans><tr>since then</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 437</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26903.22" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Place, position, degree, rank, order, office</hi>, of persons or things: <cit><quote lang="la">summus locus civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:55:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 55, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua dignitas suum locum obtinebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem locum apud ipsum Caesarem obtinuisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res erat et causa nostra eo jam loci, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:31:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 31, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Socrates voluptatem nullo loco numerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">codem loco habere, quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 17, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 77, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:84:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 84, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignantes eodem se loco esse, quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 37, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed esto, neque melius quod invenimus esse, neque par, est certe proximus locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat ordine proximus locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humili loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> loca: <cit><quote lang="la">ut patricii recuperarent duo consularia loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque augurum loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34:15" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 34, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia loca obtinuere, ne cui plebeio aditus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 57, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vesta loca prima tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:304" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 304</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of birth: <cit><quote lang="la">infimo loco natus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse summo loco natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tanaquil summo loco nata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26903.23" n="F" level="1"> Loco, adverbially, <hi rend="ital">in the place of, instead of, for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminis loco putant esse, quod vivam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec filium suum sibi praemii loco deposcit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 144</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
locusta: <entryFree id="n26904" type="main" key="lo_^custa1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lō^custa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭc-</orth>; scanned <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcusta</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> in Matt. 3, 1, 339</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marine shell-fish, a lobster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 50, § 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locustis squillisque magna ex parte sub eodem munimento praeduri eminent oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 35, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, dic mihi hoc etiam: solent tibi umquam oculi duri fieri? <hi rend="ital">Men.</hi> Quid? tu me locustam censes esse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 24</bibl>.— Prov.: prius pariet locusta Lucam bovem, said of something that can never take place, of something impossible, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=39" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 39</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n26904.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A locust</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 29, 43, § 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esca ejus erat locustae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26905" type="main" key="Locusta2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Locusta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lūcusta</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woman famous for her skill in poisons, in the time of Nero and Claudius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:71" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26906" type="main" key="Lo_custa3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lōcusta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
locutio: <entryFree id="n26907" type="main" key="lo^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcūtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lŏquūtio</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>loquor</etym>, <sense id="n26907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a speaking</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26907.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26907.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a speaking,<cb n="LOGO" />  speech, discourse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo est oratio remissa et finitima quotidianae locutioni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex locutione, ex reticentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam omnis locutio oratio est, tamen unius oratoris locutio hoc proprio signata nomine est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26907.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">way of speaking, pronunciation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emendata et Latina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:258" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 74, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26907.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an utterance, word, mode of expression, phrase</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quidam dicere maluerunt locutiones (quam verba),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copia locutionum talium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
locutius: <entryFree id="n26908" type="main" key="Locutius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Locutius</orth>, v. Aius.</entryFree>
locutor: <entryFree id="n26909" type="main" key="lo^cu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcūtor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lŏquūtor</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>loquor</etym>, <sense id="n26909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who speaks, a speaker</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n26909.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">rudis locutor exotici sermonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26909.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a talker, prater, babbler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leves et futiles et importuni locutores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
locutuleius: <entryFree id="n26910" type="main" key="lo^cu_tu^le_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcūtŭlēius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">babbling, prating;</hi> perh. only as <hi rend="ital">substt</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26910.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcū-tŭlēius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a talker, prater, babbler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres nostri hoc genus homines in verba projectos locutuleios et blaterones et lingulacas dixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26910.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcū-tŭlēĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female babbler</hi>, = linguaculae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 50, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
locutuleus: <entryFree id="n26911" type="main" key="lo^cu_tu^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcūtŭlĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prating, loquacious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ranae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 5, 160</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
locutus: <entryFree id="n26912" type="main" key="lo^cu_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lŏqu-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from loquor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26913" type="hapax" key="lo^cu_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏcūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lŏquūtus</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>loquor</etym>, <sense id="n26913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a speaking, speech</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">soluto locutu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 352, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lodicula: <entryFree id="n26914" type="main" key="lo_di_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōdīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lodix</etym>, <sense id="n26914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small coverlet, blanket</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">segestri vel lodicula involutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lodiculam in pavimento extendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 20, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lodix: <entryFree id="n26915" type="main" key="lo_dix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōdix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 42</bibl>), <sense id="n26915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coverlet, blanket, counterpane</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:195" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:66" default="NO">7, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:152:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 152, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
loebasius: <entryFree id="n26916" type="gloss" key="Loebasius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Loebasius</orth>, v. 2. Liber <sense id="n26916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
loebertas: <entryFree id="n26917" type="gloss" key="loebertas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">loebertas</orth> and ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">loebesum</orth>, v. 1. liber <sense id="n26917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
loedoria: <entryFree id="n26918" type="greek" key="loedo^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">loedŏrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">loidori/a</foreign>, <sense id="n26918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">open reviling, gross abuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loedoria exprobratio ad directam contumeliam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
logaoedicus: <entryFree id="n26919" type="greek" key="lo^ga^oedi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏgăoedĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-dĭăcus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">logaoidiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">logaœdic</hi>: metrum, <hi rend="ital">a dactylic verse in which trochees take the place of the last two dactyls</hi>, Mar. Vict. p. 2560 P. al.</sense></entryFree>
logarion: <entryFree id="n26920" type="greek" key="lo^ga^ri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏgărĭon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">loga/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n26920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little account-book</hi>, i. e. in which small matters are entered: <cit><quote lang="la">chartas ad ratiunculam vel ad logarion paratas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:9:3:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 9, 3, § 11</bibl></cit> (by others written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
logeum: <entryFree id="n26921" type="greek" key="lo^ge_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏgēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏgĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">logei=on</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">lo/gion</foreign>, <sense id="n26921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that part of the stage on which the actors spoke, the pulpitum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 8, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26921.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Archives</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam de logeo parum provisum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 6</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
logica: <entryFree id="n26922" type="greek" key="lo^gi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏgĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏgĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">logikh/</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">te/xnh</foreign>), <sense id="n26922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">logic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 2, 22, 1</bibl>; written as Greek: in altera philosophiae parte, quae est quaerendi ac disserendi, quae <foreign lang="greek">logikh/</foreign> dicitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
logicus: <entryFree id="n26923" type="greek" key="lo^gi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏgĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">logiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">logical, reasonable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haeresis medicorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia logica, alia aloga memorantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 949</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n26923.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏgĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ logika/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">logic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habes ea, quae de perturbationibus enucleate disputant Stoici, quae logica appellant, quia disseruntur subtilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 14, 33</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏgĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">logic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 15, 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26923.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏgĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">rational physicians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:21:216" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 21, 216</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
logista: <entryFree id="n26924" type="greek" key="lo^gista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏgista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">logisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accountant;</hi> under the later emperors a high civic functionary: <cit><quote lang="la">curator reipublicae, qui Graeco vocabulo logista nuncupatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 54, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 798</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
logistoricus: <entryFree id="n26925" type="greek" key="Lo^gisto^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŏgistŏrĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">logistoriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lost work of Varro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Varro in Logistorico, qui inscriptus est Cato aut de liberis educandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:19:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 19, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
logodaedalia: <entryFree id="n26926" type="greek" key="lo^go^daeda^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏgŏdaedălĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">logodaidali/a</foreign>, <sense id="n26926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an excessive nicety in one's words, affectation in selecting expressions</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
logographus: <entryFree id="n26927" type="greek" key="lo^go^gra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏgŏgrăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">logogra/fos</foreign>, <pb n="1076" /> <cb n="LONG" /> <sense id="n26927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accountant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
logos: <entryFree id="n26928" type="greek" key="lo^gos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏgos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lo/gos</foreign>, <sense id="n26928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a word</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26928.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">non longos logos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26928.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26928.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Mere words, empty talk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dabuntur dotis tibi sescenti logei atque Attici omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n26928.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A witty saying, bon-mot, jest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">logos ridiculos vendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: omnes logos, qui ludis dicti sunt, animadvertisse, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 63, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26928.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabellae et Aesopei logi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26928.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Reason</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">logos aut methodos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 67</bibl></cit>: logos aut methodus, Marc. Carm. de Medic. 6.</sense></entryFree>
loliaceus: <entryFree id="n26929" type="main" key="lo^li^a_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏlĭācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lolium</etym>, <sense id="n26929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of darnel, darnel-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">farina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
loliarius: <entryFree id="n26930" type="main" key="lo^li^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏlĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to darnel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cribrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
loligiuncula: <entryFree id="n26931" type="main" key="lo_li_gi^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōlīgĭuncŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lollig-</orth>), or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lōlīgun-cŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">loll-</orth>), <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>loligo</etym>, <sense id="n26931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little cuttlefish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
loligo: <entryFree id="n26932" type="main" key="lo_li_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōlīgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">loll-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cuttle-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 79</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 28, 44, § 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:70:145" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 70, 145</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic nigrae sucus loliginis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lolium: <entryFree id="n26933" type="main" key="lo^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n26933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">darnel, cockle, tares</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelix lolium et steriles dominantur avenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 5, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lolio victitare,</quote> <trans><tr>to have bad eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et careant loliis oculos vitiantibus agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:691" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 691</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lollius: <entryFree id="n26934" type="main" key="Lolli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lollĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n26934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. So, M. Lollius Palicanus, <hi rend="ital">governor of Galatia and afterwards of Gaul, a favorite of Augustus, famous for his rapacity and a defeat which he suffered in Germany</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:41:section=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 41, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:97" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 13</bibl>; to him is addressed <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9</bibl>.— In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lollia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 50</bibl>.—Lollia Paulina, <hi rend="ital">a daughter of</hi> M. Lollius, <hi rend="ital">and mistress of the emperor Claudius, who was murdered at the instigation of Agrippina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Plin. 9, 35, 58, § 117</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26934.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lollĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Lollius, Lollian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clades,</quote> <trans><tr>the defeat suffered by M. Lollius in Germany</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:97" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lomentarius: <entryFree id="n26935" type="gloss" key="lo_menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōmentārĭus</orth> <foreign lang="greek">smhgmatopw/lhs</foreign>, <sense id="n26935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sells</hi> lomentum, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lomentum: <entryFree id="n26936" type="main" key="lo_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lavo</etym>, <sense id="n26936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mixture of bean-meal and rice kneaded together, used by the Roman ladies for preserving the smoothness of their skin</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26936.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lomento rugas condere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:42:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 42, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex faba lomentum factum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 14, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26936.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26936.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of blue color, azure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lomentum est caeruleo candidius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 13, 57, § 162</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26936.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Bean-meal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lomentum appellatur ea farina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 117</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n26936.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a wash, cosmetic</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 14, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lonchitis: <entryFree id="n26937" type="greek" key="lonchi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lonchītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">logxi=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n26937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, the tongue-shaped stander-grass, satyrion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 88, § 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:76" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 48, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lonchoton: <entryFree id="n26938" type="main" key="loncho_ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lonchōton</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">logxwto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of copperas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 12, 32, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lonchus: <entryFree id="n26939" type="greek" key="lonchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lonchus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lunch-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lo/gxos</foreign>, <sense id="n26939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lance</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
londinium: <entryFree id="n26940" type="main" key="Londi_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Londīnĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lund-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n26940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Britain</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">London</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28, 3, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26940.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lon-dīnĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of London</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum Londiniense,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Paneg. ad Const. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
longabo: <entryFree id="n26941" type="main" key="longa^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longăbo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. longanon.</entryFree>
longaevitas: <entryFree id="n26942" type="main" key="longaevi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longaevĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>longaevus</etym>, <sense id="n26942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">long life, longevity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corvorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: alicui longaevitatem indulgere, Ambros. de Caïn et Ab. 2, 10, § 37.</sense></entryFree>
longaevus: <entryFree id="n26943" type="main" key="longaevus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longaevus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>longus-aevum</etym>, <sense id="n26943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of great age, aged, ancient</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 169</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 525</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 52: <cit><quote lang="la">pons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:864" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 864</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:10:47" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 10, 47</bibl></cit> (3, 5, 31): <cit><quote lang="la">vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26943.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">longaeva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an old woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctantem longaeva manu deducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 462</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
longanimis: <entryFree id="n26944" type="main" key="longa^ni^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longănĭmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>longus-animus</etym>, <sense id="n26944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">long-suffering, patient</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dominus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:102:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 102, 8 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
longanimitas: <entryFree id="n26945" type="main" key="longa^ni^mi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longănĭmĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>longanimis</etym>, <sense id="n26945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">long-suffering, patience, forbearance</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl> Pet. 3, 15; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 5, 42</bibl>. <cb n="LONG" /></sense></entryFree>
longanimiter: <entryFree id="n26946" type="main" key="longa^ni^mi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longănĭmĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>longanimis</etym>, <sense id="n26946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with long-suffering, patiently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 10, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
longanon: <entryFree id="n26947" type="main" key="longa^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longănon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">-găno</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-găbo</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-găvo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-găo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>), <sense id="n26947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the straight gut</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 42, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 56, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:22:220" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 22, 220</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26947.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sausage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 11</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 229</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
longanus: <entryFree id="n26948" type="main" key="Longa_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Longānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., inhabitant of Longula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 69</bibl> (al. Longulani).</sense></entryFree>
longe: <entryFree id="n26949" type="main" key="longe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. longus <sense id="n26949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
longiloquium: <entryFree id="n26950" type="main" key="longi^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>longus-loqui</etym>, <sense id="n26950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a long speech</hi>, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 1, 33, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
longimanus: <entryFree id="n26951" type="main" key="Longi^ma^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Longĭmănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>longus-manus, long-hand, i. e. that has an uncommonly long forearm</etym>, <sense id="n26951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Artaxerxes, king of Persia;</hi> a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*makro/xeir</foreign>, Hier. in Chron. Euseb. ad Olymp. LXXIX.; v. Macrochir.</sense></entryFree>
longinque: <entryFree id="n26952" type="main" key="longinque_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longinquē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. longinquus <sense id="n26952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
longinquitas: <entryFree id="n26953" type="main" key="longinqui^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longinquĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>longinquus</etym>, <sense id="n26953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">length, extent</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26953.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26953.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:62" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 33, § 63</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26953.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">distance, remoteness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo propter longinquitatem tardissime omnia perferuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26953.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of time. </sense><sense id="n26953.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">length, long continuance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">duration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissimi morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26953.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">long duration, length of time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(dolores) longinquitate producti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longinquitate potestatem dominantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
longinquo: <entryFree id="n26954" type="main" key="longinquo_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longinquō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. longinquus <sense id="n26954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26955" type="main" key="longi^nquo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longĭnquo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>longinquus</etym>, <sense id="n26955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remove to a distance, put afar off</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">deum a se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 34" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 34</bibl>, Serm. 2, n. 6.</sense></entryFree>
longinquus: <entryFree id="n26956" type="main" key="longinquus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longinquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>longus</etym>, <sense id="n26956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">long, extensive</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26956.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in space. </sense><sense id="n26956.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">linea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 26, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26956.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26956.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Far removed, far off, remote, distant</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nos longinqui et a te ipso missi in ultimas gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex locis tam longinquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab extero hoste atque longinquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longinqua Lacedaemon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <trans><tr>respecting things that are far off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longinquiores loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera, i. e. e longinquo accepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 568</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: ex (e) longinquo, <hi rend="ital">from afar, from a distance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e longinquo intueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 22</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longinqua imperii adire,</quote> <trans><tr>the remote parts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26956.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Living far off, foreign, strange</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo longinquus et alienigena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clodius aequaliter in longinquos, in propinquos, in alienos, in suos irruebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 28, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:150" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26956.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of time. </sense><sense id="n26956.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">long, of long duration</hi> or <hi rend="ital">continuance, prolonged, lasting, continued, tedious</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diutinus, diuturnus): vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfert vetustas omnibus in rebus longinqua observatione incredibilem scientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:49:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 49, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longinquiore tempore bellum confecturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26956.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26956.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Long deferred, distant</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum spe perrumpendi periculi, vel in longinquum tempus differendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:32:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 32, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ... aut tempore longinqua aut praeceps periculo victoria esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes longinqua et sera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 37</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n26956.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Old, ancient</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 26, § 83</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26956.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Remote, far-fetched</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt et durae (translationes), id est a longinqua similitudine ductae, ut "capitis nives," etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in three forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lon-ginquē</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">longinquō</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">longin-quom</orth> (only ante- and post - class.). </sense><sense id="n26956.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A long way off, far away</hi>: longinque ab domo bellum gerentes, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 515, 14</bibl> (Trag. v. 103, Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n26956.13" n="2" level="3"> In time, <hi rend="ital">long, a long while</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odiosast oratio, quom rem agas, longinquom loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus longinquo absens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 3</bibl></cit>; so <cb n="LONG" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:44" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 3, 44</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longinquius diutiusque adesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26956.14" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">After a long interval</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">historiam scripsere Pictor incondite, Sisenna longinque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad Ver. 1" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad Ver. 1</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
longinus: <entryFree id="n26957" type="main" key="Longi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Longīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>longus</etym>, <sense id="n26957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the</hi> gens Cassia.—So, Cassius Longinus, v. Cassius.—</sense><sense id="n26957.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Grecian philosopher, minister of Zenobia, who was put to death by Aurelian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
longipes: <entryFree id="n26958" type="main" key="longi^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longĭpēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>longus-pes</etym>, <sense id="n26958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">longfooted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simillimum scarabeo longipedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 4, 10, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longipedes porrectis ad caudam cruribus volant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 47, 107, § 257</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
longisco: <entryFree id="n26959" type="hapax" key="longisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n26959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. inch.</hi> [longus], <hi rend="ital">to become long</hi> (perh. languisco = languidum fieri, frangi, <hi rend="ital">to become faint, weak, languid</hi>), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 134, 19</bibl> (Ann. v. 480 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
longiter: <entryFree id="n26960" type="main" key="longi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. longus <sense id="n26960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
longitia: <entryFree id="n26961" type="main" key="longi^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longĭtĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">longĭcĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>longus</etym>, <sense id="n26961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">length</hi> (late Lat.), Auct. de Limit. p. 271; Goes. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 6, 2, 2</bibl> (Schneid. longitudo).</sense></entryFree>
